Grab stray flies that get caught in the web for extra points as you try to reach the top ten high scores. Spider Run is filled with educational spiders facts as well!

Source: The Developer Website.

141406.name: Squarex
141406.description:
Squarex is an exciting fast paced game where you maneuver your yellow cube around a puzzle board capturing grids by traveling all 4 sides. Watch out for the red cubes chasing you as you try to complete all 50 levels of these mind-bending mazes.

Source: The Developer Website.

141407.name: Taxi Run
141407.description:
Taxi Run has you racing against the clock picking up and dropping off passengers in this exciting arcade game. The strategy is to keep your taxi on the move by rotating road sections with the click of your mouse. The smooth scrolling graphics and a mouse interface make Taxi Run a challenge for both young and old. Can you beat the heat of New York traffic?

Source: The Developer Website.

141408.name: Wall Pipe
141408.description:
Wall Pipe is the sequel to our DOS game, Oilcap. Race against the clock as you try to place down pipes in an effort to keep the water flowing as long as possible. Gain extra points for connecting tubs, sinks and more. A fast pace, a lot of strategy and planning are needed to reach the higher levels. Many surprises await you as you try for the Top Ten High Scores.

Source: The Developer Website.

141409.name: Wordle
141409.description:
Wordle is a word puzzle game that is both educational and addictive! On the game board, there are 25 random letters on a 5x5 grid. The objective is to spell as many words as you can by using the letters on the grid that are adjacent to each other. Your words are checked against Wordle’s 80,000 word master dictionary. The game is addicting!

Source: The Developer Website.

141410.name: WordMax
141410.description:
WordMax is another Soleau Software logic Word Game. The objective is to spell as many words as you can using letters from a master word. Your entries are checked against a full dictionary of over 80,000 words. WordMax is packed with features like adding custom words and dictionary options, along with up to 8 personal scorecards. It’s addicting, educational and fun for the entire family.

Source: The Developer Website.

141411.name: Taffy's Party Game
141411.description:
Taken from the instruction sheet:

"Taffy's four party scenes are shown on the board - but where are the guests? Each player is Taffy, trying to be the "hostess with the mostest" by making the right scene with the right guests.
Players start with random guest cards for all the parties. You make the party rounds according to your calls on the telephone. The spaces on the board match the shapes of the guest cards. Whenever you land in a space for which you have a guest card for a matching shape, you must place that guest in the space. Funny scenes will develop, such as pajamas appearing at the formal party, guests in bathing suits frolicking in the snow, etc.
Whenever you are able to take the correct guest to the correct party, you receive a picture card. The WINNER is the player who can show she is the best hostess by placing the most guests correctly and collecting the most pictures."

141412.description:
Hoplomachus [ha-ploh-ma-kuss], or "Hoplo" for short, is a hex-based tactical board game set inside a gladiatorial arena. One to four players, each representing an ancient city/civilization thought to have been lost to the world, are now on Rome's doorstep vying for a place in the prestigious arena games.

Players have a very clear objective: Eliminate the opponent's champion. Champions start the game in the arena but are inactive and defenseless. They will not fight until the crowd is behind them. Each player takes turns drawing, playing and moving gladiators from their "hand" and assisting them with tactic chips.

Based on opponent's moves and play style, each person will need to adjust their strategies. Defend your champ, take over and hold the crowd favor areas, assault opponent's champion, cover deployment zones, eliminate tactictions to reduce enemy options, fight beasts to gain crowd favor, the list of tactical possibilities is endless.

Hoplomachus combines combat, tactics, chip (units) management, level progression (though crowd favor system), team play, player vs board, and so much more.

Blade's Edge: These 10 chips include an all new Champion AND Equipment for each of the 5 Cities that Hoplomachus has to offer. These will be the start of what will be the 'customizable' portion of the game. Champion selection and Equipment option will be determined before each battle begins!

Carpe Venatus!
141412.name: Hoplomachus: Blade's Edge

141413.description:
Hoplomachus [ha-ploh-ma-kuss], or "Hoplo" for short, is a hex-based tactical board game set inside a gladiatorial arena. One to four players, each representing an ancient city/civilization thought to have been lost to the world, are now on Rome's doorstep vying for a place in the prestigious arena games.

Players have a very clear objective: Eliminate the opponent's champion. Champions start the game in the arena but are inactive and defenseless. They will not fight until the crowd is behind them. Each player takes turns drawing, playing and moving gladiators from their "hand" and assisting them with tactic chips.

Based on opponent's moves and play style, each person will need to adjust their strategies. Defend your champ, take over and hold the crowd favor areas, assault opponent's champion, cover deployment zones, eliminate tacticians to reduce enemy options, fight beasts to gain crowd favor, the list of tactical possibilities is endless.

Hoplomachus combines combat, tactics, chip (units) management, level progression (though crowd favor system), team play, player vs board, and so much more.

Legends of the Sand: These 15 chips include all new Gladiators AND Tactics for each of the 5 Cities that Hoplomachus has to offer. These will be the start of what will be the 'customizable' portion of the game. Gladiator and Tactic selections will be made before each battle begins!

Carpe Venatus!
141413.name: Hoplomachus: Legends of the Sand

141414.name: Public Playtest Package (2013-04-11)

rpg.25424: Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition, Playtest & Promotional Docs)

141414.description:
This playtest package was the same as the package released on 2013-04-01, but four Bestiaries containing conversions of creatures from the S-series modules were added to the pack.

This playtest packet included:

- A "Read First" document (3 pages)
- A How To Play guide (25 pages)
- A Creating a Character guide (5 pages)
- A Classes guide (49 pages)
- A Races guide (8 pages)
- A Backgrounds and Skills guide (6 pages)
- A Specialties and Feats guide (14 pages)
- A Spells guide (50 pages)
- An Equipment guide (11 pages)
- A DM Guidelines guide (23 pages)
- A Bestiary (91 pages)
- A Magic Items guide (31 pages)
- Six pre-generated character sheets (10 pages)
- A blank character sheet (2 pages)
- An adventure, Caves of Chaos (23 pages)
- An adventure, Reclaiming Blingdenstone (40 pages)
- An adventure, Isle of Dread (44 pages)
- An adventure, The Mud Sorcerer's Tomb (34 pages)
- Adventure conversion notes for Against the Cult of Chaos (19 pages)
- Adventure conversion notes for Storm over Neverwinter (21 pages)
- An adventure, Mines of Madness (47 pages)
- Six pre-gens for Mines of Madness (10 pages)
- Bestiary for Module S1: Tomb of Horrors (7 pages)
- Bestiary for Module S2: White Plume Mountain (14 pages)
- Bestiary for Module S3: Expedition to the Barrier Peaks (27 pages)
- Bestiary for Module S4: The Lost Caverns of Tsojcanth (41 pages)

141415.name: Dragon (Issue 422 - Apr 2013)

rpgissuearticle.126319: Court of Stars: Hyrsam, Prince of Satyrs

141415.description:
Table of contents

3 A Funny Thing Happened... by Steve Winter
"Dying is easy; comedy is hard." Those words weren't written for roleplayers, but they could have been.

4 Hyrsam, Prince of Satyrs by Mark Monack
Hyrsam is so ancient that he remembers — and misses — a time before Corellon and the other gods discovered the Feywild.

9 Tinker Gnomes by Daniel Helmick
As dwarves need to mine and elves need to sing, the tinker gnomes of Krynn need to invent.

14 Building Character by Matt Sernett
Have you grown tired of humble farm boys and rebellious duke’s daughters? Roll up a new, unique background for your hero.

35 Barlar's Bucket Helm by Ed Greenwood
Barlar Belasko is a man of above average height, handsomeness, and ego. But an annoyed wizard brought him down a peg.

141416.description:
The game re-creates the Battle of Ravenna, fought on 11 April 1512 (tragic Easter day), by forces of the Holy League and France. The players are divided into two camps and guide the opposing armies with the sole purpose of defeating the opponent.
This game introduces a new mechanic like referring to a real circumstance. At that time give orders in battle was very difficult and in the chain of command it happened that someone not obey to the orders: the same thing will happen in the game where each team can decide whether and when to comply with an order.
141416.name: Ravenna Fatto d'Arme

141418.name: LEADERS - board game and app
141418.description:
LEADERS: A Combined Game, the first title from rudy games GmbH, combines classic game elements with the opportunities offered by the modern technologies found in smart devices.

This strategy game takes up to six players back to the Cold War era, with each player striving to attain world domination. In the game, you'll use skillful diplomacy to forge powerful alliances, research ground-breaking technologies to give yourself the decisive edge, dispatch secret agents to procure classified information about your opponents, participate in missions on behalf of the international community, and demonstrate your military power and conquer new areas.

Thanks to the incorporation of a smart device in this design, LEADERS: A Combined Game enables a complex economy, involved research threads, and clandestine interactions with other players such as espionage or sabotage.

ATTENTION: The "LEADERS" video game/app is required for playing!

28952.name: Shanghai Creative Tree Cultural Spreading Co. LTD.

141419.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Koi Pond: A Coy Card Game is a lovely, clever game for 2-4 players. Collect colorful koi fish and choose whether to place them in your pond or in your house. You'll score points only for the *lower* number, though, so keep your pond and house as balanced as you can. Your pond is public, but your house is secret. To win, you have to be...coy!

Each turn, players take turns drawing a card from the face-down deck or from the face-up "lake" until everyone has three new cards in hand. Then all players simultaneously choose from amongst their entire hand one card to add to their personal pond and one to discard to their personal "river". Cards in your river will eventually go to the lake, so choose carefully.

After six turns, the round ends. Score points by comparing the total number of koi of a suit in your pond and your house. Score points equal to the *lower* number. Score each suit of koi in this manner. If a crane, housecat or turtle is in your pond, you score bonus points for koi of that noted suit in your opponent's pond (crane), house (housecat) or river (turtle). Which opponent depends on the number of players and the current round.

After each round, ribbons are awarded to the player with the most koi of each suit in her river. Ribbons grant bonus points at the end of the game.

To maximize your koi score, you have to carefully balance the populations in your pond and house. A turtle, housecat, or crane earns points from an opponent's hard work, but they also take valuable space in your hand. Sending high value koi cards to your river earns more ribbons, but also makes them available to all players in the next round. The player with the most points wins!
141419.name: Koi Pond: A Coy Card Game

141420.name: Dicecards
141420.description:
From the Back of the Pack:

Dicecards are a complete dice bag in a deck of cards. Featuring over forty dice and other randomizers: everything from Poker chips to Werewolf roles to runes. There's even short straws to draw. Use Dicecards for role-playing, board games, and gambling. Simply draw a card and look for the die you need. All the probabilities are match so it's the same as rolling the real thing.

Further Description from the Back of the Guide:

This is the official guide to getting the most fro your decks of Dicecards. It gives comprehensive details of all the elements on the cards, rules for games to play with them, and reference tables.

This guide is not a stand-alone game. It requires a deck of Dicecards.

Additional User Summary:

Half the guide describes the various details on the cards themselves. The other half includes rules for the following games:

Dungeon Crawl (original game)
The Dicecards Mini-RPG (original game)
Werewolf
Pirate Dice (original game)
Cities of the World (original game)
Craps
Dreidel
Crown and Anchor
Slots (original game)
Dominoes
Word Maker (original game)
ESP Experiment (using the Zener cards)

141421.name: MightySix
141421.description:
From Introduction:

MightySix is a set of rules for super powered roleplaying intended to be compatible with the fabulous Mini Six rule set from the good people at Antipaladin Games.

Since the basic engine driving MightySix is so elegantly and eloquently described in Mini Six Bare Bones Edition, these pages contain only the additions and alterations needed to play MightySix. As a convention, capitalized words are either proper names or specific game related terms that may be easily confused with the word’s non-game meaning.

A number of ideas, outside of Mini Six Bare Bones Edition, are presented here (Complementary Skills, Powerks, Environmental Hazards etc) as well as a few old ones with a slightly different twist. For the most part, I think I’ve stayed as true to the Mini Six canon as I can, please forgive me if I’ve trampled on any dearly held conventions or scrapped someone’s favorite rule. In the spirit of Mini Six, please feel free to change, disregard or tweak these rules to your heart’s content. I won’t mind. Much.

141422.name: RHEM 2
141422.description:
RHEM 2 is an adventure game from Knut Müller and Got Game Entertainment and the sequel to RHEM. It is distributed as a Macromedia Director file.
Like Myst and Riven, Rhem 2 is a node-based first-person adventure game. The player explores a series of caverns in search of a certain artifact. The puzzles involve spatial reasoning, operating machinery, and logic.
There is little plot or character interaction in Rhem 2; the emphasis lies solely on its puzzles. Many puzzles require the player to determine his location with respect to adjacent areas or objects in order to solve it. For instance, in order to solve a puzzle it may be necessary to trace a cable through a wall between two rooms, but the path from one room to the other is circuitous.

Source: Wikipedia, "RHEM 2: The Cave", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

177253.name: Dead Men Tell No Tales: Camille E.N. Promo Card

141423.description:
Skelit's Revenge....the most feared ship on the high seas....and you've finally taken it. Captain Fromm and his skeleton crew have amassed a massive treasure, and now is your chance to take it all. Players take on the role of Pirates who are boarding Skelit's Revenge for one purpose....to take the loot. They must battle the flames, the skeleton crew, and their own fatigue if they hope to make it out alive.

Dead Men Tell No Tales is a co-operative game for 2-5 players. The game uses the common Action Point system to determine what a player does on their turn...with a twist. As players work together, they can pass their Actions on to their teammates in order to best utilize the assets that they have. Players will build the board as they play, ensuring that no two games will ever be alike. As they search the ship for the Treasure, they will encounter Enemies and Guards that they must battle, along with various items that will help them in their quest. all the while, battling the inferno that resulted when they took over the ship. Unique systems for tracking fire, enemy movement, and a player’s fatigue all combine into an interesting and unique cooperative gaming experience.

Do you and your crew have what it takes to make off with all of the treasure and live to tell the story? Or are you going down with the ship in Dead Men Tell No Tales?
141423.name: Dead Men Tell No Tales

141424.name: Rules Lawyer
141424.description:
Ever wanted to make your friend bark like a dog three times, while rubbing their belly and slapping their knee? Then we have the perfect game for you!

Rules Lawyer, by designer Nathan Hansen, is a fast-paced, light-hearted, family-fun card game for 3 or more players with ever-changing rules. Each player takes turns altering and then obeying the current rules ("Laws") of the game.

Your goal is to fulfill three Goal cards in your hand, therefore you must change the Laws (or hope someone else does) to your advantage. But beware, if you – or someone you spot – doesn't perform all of the Laws correctly or in order, you may lose some of your Goal cards, or players could steal Goal cards from you!

Great for parties, family, and friends, see what rules you can come up with in Rules Lawyer!

Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale

141425.name: Thou Art But A Warrior (Second Edition)
141425.description:
Thou Art But A Warrior - A Game of Tragedies based on Polaris, by Anna Kreider, with additional writing by Ben Lehman

Publisher blurb

Though the great Caliphate has been dissolved and the unity of Iberia's Muslims lost, their power has not failed entirely. The taifas have their armies, and at the heart of those armies are the noble orders of Muslim Knights.

These Knights swear solemn oaths to revere Allah and his Prophet, to fight for the defense of the innocent, and to honour a strict code of ethics and morals in order to bring about peace and justice for their society. They are warriors and poets, and they are the last hope of a people who do not see their doom before them.

Their inevitable failure is a thing to be mourned most deeply.

User summary

The second, revised edition (called "Complete Edition" in the colophon) was financed by a successful crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo in January 2013. This covered printing and some new art. Apart from several improvements, the second edition also includes the Polaris system (which was omitted from the first printing).
The first edition from 2008 was the winner of the International Setting Design Contest hosted on the Forge in 2007.

141427.name: Bombinoes
141427.description: Bombinoes is a game of creative connections. During the game you have tiles and attempt to form them into a line. However, all the tiles have images on them and placing a tile requires you to come up with what the tile has in common with the tile next to it. A cloud and an umbrella might be connected by "rain," for instance, while a criminal and coffee might be connected by "words starting with C." You're only able to use any kind of connection once in your line, and your opponent might break up your line with a bomb tile and force you to rethink connections on the fly, so making the 10 connections you need to win the game will take an agile mind and a creative spirit!

141428.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Be the first to get rid of all of your dice in Pass the Pandas by rolling pandas, bamboo, or water drops. A player who rolls pandas on her turn is able to pass those dice to other players. A roll of bamboo must be matched (or exceeded!) by the next player. A roll of water allows her to discard those dice. A blank roll does nothing to help her, and she must keep blank dice to roll again on her next turn. Pandas!
141428.name: Pass the Pandas

141429.name: Envoyer Spezial: Systemübersichten
141429.description:
Envoyer Spezial Nr. 1: Systemübersichten. Vorstellung der Systeme: Von AD&D über StarWars by Wasteworld

An overview of 25 RPG systems

141430.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Geek Out! is a party game that can determine once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite pop culture subjects!

In the game, you draw cards asking you to list a certain number of things which fall under a certain category: comic books, fantasy, games, science fiction, and miscellaneous. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!) by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to "out-geek" their friends. Collect a predetermined number of cards, and you win!
141430.name: Geek Out!

141431.name: Envoyer: Szenarienband 1
141431.description:
From the back of the book

Willkommen in Nimheria, der Stadt der Ganoven, der Händler und der Propheten. Wobei ich fürgleich einwenden muss, dass die Händler und die Propheten sich von den Gaunern nur unterscheiden, alsweil die Mörder und Diebe ihr Handwerk auf der dunklen Seite des Gesetzes und die Geldsäcke und die Götterboten auf der Butterseite ausüben.

Dieser Szenarienband beschreibt die Stadt Nimheria sowie das Kaiserreich Nimh. Die Namen und Gegebenheiten können Ihrem Abenteuer angepasst werden. In diesem Band erhalten Sie alle Informationen, die es Ihnen erlauben, ein eigenes Abenteuer um dieses Kaiserreich und die Stadt zu kreieren, gleich welches System Sie spielen. Stadtviertel, Gebäude und Räume werden ebenso genau beschrieben wie die Charaktere. Alles ist so aufgebaut, dass Sie bei Bedarf auch einzelne Komponenten für Ihr eigenes System verwenden können.

Jeder, der diesen Band in seinen Händen hält, wird sicherlich viel nützliches Material für sein Abenteuer finden.

User summary
This Envoyer special issue contains the rpg EASY, a simplified version of YARG (a free German rpg). The issue offers a lot of setting material and adventures around the city Nimheria, as well as four pre-generated characters. However, the setting and scenarios are kept generic to be useful for any fantasy RPG.

141433.name: Adventure MAXIMUS! Rule Book (Beta)
141433.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome To Adventure MAXIMUS! a role playing game where making a character is as easy as drawing cards and even kids can be game masters.

The great thing about Adventure MAXIMUS! is the adventures can take place in any world, even one you make up yourselves. But if you’d like to just use the world we made up for Adventure MAXIMUS! adventures, it’s named Ex-Machina. Before the world was broken it was known as Magisterica, but ever since the end of the Reign of the Wise Wizard Kings it has been known as Ex-Machina. Ex-Machina is a fantastic post-apocalyptic world where mythical creatures roam and food and trees can talk. Ex-Machina is ruled by several Nations, including The Woodland Realm of The Elves, The Goblin Council of Tinkers, The Verte Republic, The Take-Out Kingdom and The Dwarven Underground Empire.

141434.name: Boss Fight!: Six Tips for Running the Battles with the Big Bad Guys
141434.description:
From Introduction:

Boss fights can be the most exciting part of an Adventure Maximus! quest but how do you handle it and make it fun for your players? Here are a few tips to make that battle a memorable one

141435.name: Forest Police!
141435.description:
From Introduction:

The bell on the Adventure Company’s call box rings. The note inside says there’s a mystery in the woods, and Sergeant Bumbles a talking Bear with the forest Police, needs a few good Adventurers to solve the case.

141436.name: No Name!
141436.description:
From Introduction:

The Adventurers are hired by King Fry of the Take-Out Kingdom who has learned that villains are up to no good in his land. The Adventurers are to protect the clock / heating lamp tower at all costs.

141437.description:
What the Food?! is a fast-paced card game for 3-8 players capturing the experience of a classic cafeteria food fight! Pick up food, throw funny combos at your opponents and duck to avoid "humiliation" points from flying food impact.

In the center is a draw deck, with five food or other cards exposed at any one time to make up the "cafeteria floor". Players start the game with three standard actions and one special action unique to their character. Every round, each player chooses three of their action cards, and puts them in a stack representing the next three turns. The turns are then resolved at once, but in clockwise rotation to handle any timing conflicts. Players can gain additional actions during the game, and global school events occur, instantly causing random chaos.

When any player reaches 10 humiliation points, someone has "alerted the principal" and the fight is over at the end of that round. The winner is the person with the LOWEST humiliation score.
141437.name: What the Food?!

141439.description:
In conjunction with the release of Alien Frontiers: Rocket Dice, Alien Frontiers' 4th Edition board is double sided. Side A has the standard docking ports for standard D6 dice. Side B has Rocket Dice docking ports that will comfortably fit Rocket Dice. The board is the same size as previous additions so you can retrofit your current copy of Alien Frontiers by adding a new board.

NOTE: The double sided board has a misprint on the standard D6 side, where the arrows showing which way the colonies are supposed to travel is missing.
141439.name: Alien Frontiers: 4th Edition Board

141440.description: Inspired by the retro-future scifi of the 1950's, Rocket Dice will add a unique vibe to any space-themed board game in need of dice. Created specifically to add flavor to Alien Frontiers. (The Alien Frontiers: 4th Edition Board will be compatible with Rocket Dice.) Rocket Dice can be used with ANY game that uses standard six-sided dice.
141440.name: Alien Frontiers: Rocket Dice

141441.name: Romancing SaGa (2005)
141441.description:
User Summary

Romancing SaGa for the PlayStation 2 is an enhanced remake with three-dimensional graphics instead of two dimensional environments and character sprites. The eight original characters can now assume the role of 38 different classes which gives them access to differing statistics and special abilities.

The weapons held by a character will now determine which of their randomly increased stats will have a greater chance of increasing after battle. Combat has also been expanded to include a new "Spell Sythesis" system, where specific magics can be fused together to create a modified version of a spell with greater power, or even create a new spell altogether. Additional story scenarios and areas have been added for the remake, including a new script and expanded narrative with new content.

141442.name: Homie Rollerz
141442.description:
Homies Rollerz is a goofy racing game of an underground racing theme where drivers compete in races that allow a variety of mild weaponry and compete for Respect which allows more customization options for their vehicles.
User Summary

Features
-Pimp your engine for more horsepower and jack those hydraulics
-Trick your car out with spoilers and custom paint
-Win races and do tricks to earn Respect points for more car details
-Intense multiplayer racing for up to 8 players via Wi-Fi
-Playable in both English and Spanish languages

Source: The Developer Website.

141443.name: Kar Racing
141443.description:
Race your way through 5 different circuits. Choose from 10 cars with different handling characteristics. Keep an eye on the guages with the on-screen heads-up display. View the race from multiple camera angles.

Features
5 different racing circuits
10 challenging cars
Different handling characteristics
On screen heads-up display
Different camera angles
Lighting and sound effects

Source: The Developer Website.

141444.name: King's Collection
141444.description:
Amazing New Twists on Classic Card Games!
6 great twists on the classic card games. Gorgeous themed environments with delightful interactive characters. Variable skill settings for players of all experience.

Features All These Card Games:
Gin Rummy
Canasta
Free Cell
TriPeaks
Aces High
Spider Solitaire

Source: The Developer Website.

141445.name: Magic Hat
141445.description:
Guide Presto through dozens of mazes and help him defeat his enemies!
Run and jump your way through dozens of perilous mazes, but watch out for dangerous enemies! Including invading aliens, crazy eskimos, robot balls, and more. Use your magician's sheet to cover your enemies, incapacitating them for a short period and allowing you to escape! As you progress through each level, you gain coins which you can use to upgrade your character.

Different Worlds to Explore:
Jungly Tropics
Polar Ice Caps
Crazy Castles
Spookey Space

Features
40 amazing levels
A multitude of weapons
Loads of silly enemies
Smooth scrolling
Digital sound effects and music

Source: The Developer Website.

141446.name: Mahjong (2011)
141446.description:
The ancient solitaire Mahjong game at it's finest! Choose from a gaggle of backgrounds, tilesets, and layouts. Ask the computer to reveal the best moves. Backup moves and save your current game for another time. Play guaranteed winnable or totally random games. Keep track of your playing time and other game stats. WARNING: This game is addictive!

Features
51 layouts to play
101 backgrounds
37 themed tilesets
Computer hints feature
Backup moves button
Save game and restart games
Soothing soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

141447.name: Mahjong Christmas
141447.description:
This solitaire version of Mahjong is quick to learn but takes a long time to master! Choose from a gaggle of different backgrounds, tilesets, and layouts. The ancient solitaire game at it's finest. Ask the computer to reveal the best moves. Backup moves and save your current game for playback at another time. Play guaranteed winnable or totally random games. Keep track of your playing time and other game stats at all times. WARNING: This game is addicting!
This special edition features adorable Christmas-themed backgrounds and tilesets!

Features
Christmas-themed graphics
51 layouts to play
10 holiday backgrounds
5 merry tilesets
Computer hints feature
Backup moves button
Save game and restart games

Source: The Developer Website.

141448.name: Mahjong Easter
141448.description:
This solitaire version of Mahjong is quick to learn but takes a long time to master! Choose from a gaggle of different backgrounds, tilesets, and layouts. The ancient solitaire game at it's finest. Ask the computer to reveal the best moves. Backup moves and save your current game for playback at another time. Play guaranteed winnable or totally random games. Keep track of your playing time and other game stats at all times. WARNING: This game is addicting!
This special edition features adorable Easter-themed backgrounds and tilesets!

Features
Easter-themed graphics
51 layouts to play
10 backgrounds
5 tilesets
Computer hints feature
Backup moves button
Save game and restart games
The Easter Bunny!

Source: The Developer Website.

141449.name: Mahjong Halloween
141449.description:
The ancient solitaire Mahjong game at it's finest! Choose from a gaggle of backgrounds, tilesets, and layouts. Ask the computer to reveal the best moves. Backup moves and save your current game for another time. Play guaranteed winnable or totally random games. Keep track of your playing time and other game stats. WARNING: This game is addictive!
This special edition features spooky Halloween-themed backgrounds and tilesets!

Features
Halloween-themed graphics
51 layouts to play
10 spooky backgrounds
5 haunted tilesets
Computer hints feature
Backup moves button
Save game and restart games
Soothing soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

141450.name: Mahjong Kittens
141450.description:
The ancient solitaire Mahjong game at it's finest! Choose from a gaggle of backgrounds, tilesets, and layouts. Ask the computer to reveal the best moves. Backup moves and save your current game for another time. Play guaranteed winnable or totally random games. Keep track of your playing time and other game stats. WARNING: This game is addictive!
This special edition features adorable Kitten-themed backgrounds and tilesets!

Features
Kittens-themed graphics
51 layouts to play
10 kitten backgrounds
5 kitten tilesets
Computer hints feature
Backup moves button
Save game and restart games
Soothing soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

141451.name: Mahjong: Ancient China Adventure
141451.description:
Play classic Mahjong or play an adventure through ancient China. A new twist on an ancient game. In multi-player mode, battle it out between your friends to see who can solve the Mahjong puzzle the fastest. In adventure mode, explore and uncover the wonders of ancient China. Cool animations and a soothing soundtrack make this a great addition to you Nintendo DS® library of must-have games.
Features

Classic Mahjong
Adventure mode
50 layouts
Save game feature
Multiplayer mode

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgameimplementation.4916: Great War at Sea: 1904-1905, The Russo-Japanese War

189358.name: Great War at Sea: Rise of the Dragon

141452.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

Japan entered the modern age in 1868, with a new young emperor determined to make his island nation a world power. After decades of steady progress, Japan began its own practice of colonialism, defeating China in 1894. As the Japanese began to infiltrate the semi-independent Kingdom of Korea, they ran into Russian agents doing the same. Despite Japanese offers to negotiate, elements within the Russian Empire were set on war.

Great War at Sea: Russo-Japanese War covers the naval aspects of the resulting conflict, which opened with a Japanese surprise attack on the Russian Pacific Fleet’s base at Port Arthur in northern China. There are 50 scenarios, including the climactic Battle of Tsushima, as well as hypothetical actions ranging from an early dispute resulting from the 1895 "Triple Intervention" to a showdown in 1906 with greatly reinforced Russian and Japanese fleets.

The Russian fleet is a mixed bag of modern battleships and ancient ironclads better suited for a museum. The Pacific Fleet that begins the game in the Far East has modern ships stationed at Port Arthur and a cruiser squadron in Vladivostok. Between them lies Korea, occupied by Japan. The Russian strategic situation is difficult.

The Japanese have a better fleet; though not as large, their armored cruisers outclass their Russian counterparts and their torpedo boats are more numerous and more effective. They are also better-led after the death of the Russian Admiral Makarov.

The map covers the Japanese home islands and the seas around them. As with other games in the series, it’s divided into zones 32 miles across. Fleets attempt to locate one another on this map. When contact is made, play moves to a tactical map where ships maneuver and fight.

The previous edition of this game (Great War at Sea: 1904-1905) won the Origins Award for Best Historical Game due to play balance and simplicity. Without aircraft, play is even faster than in other games in the series. The strategic situation is challenging to both players, and competitive balance is keen without sacrificing the historical accuracy of the game as a simulation. Unlike most wars, the Russo-Japanese naval war took place between opponents reasonably matched in terms of vessels and numbers (albeit not in training), and that makes for a tense and exciting game.

Russo-Japanese War includes:
• One 34 x 22-inch operational map
• One 22 x 22-inch tactical map
• 210 playing pieces
• A game booklet including 50 scenarios
141452.name: Great War at Sea: Russo-Japanese War

141453.name: Marble Flip
141453.description:
Twist and turn your way to the next level! Tilt the board and steer the marble into the goal. Watch out for ice, traps, holes, and even other marbles.

Features
Over 50 levels!
Highscores table
Digital sound effects and music
Mouse and keyboard control

Source: The Developer Website.

141454.name: Mazetrix
141454.description:
New gem puzzle game!
Arrange gems in this fast-paced puzzle challenge. Each maze is unique, each time you play the mazes are different. As you level-up, the gem line gets longer and the challenge increases. The in game scoreboard tracks the highest scores. Do you have what it takes to make the leaderboard?
It's endless addictive play with an infinitive number of computer generated levels! How high can you go? Level 10? Level 100? Level 500? You'll never run out of levels to play in Mazetrix!

Features
A super puzzle challenge
Use the touch-screen to drag gems
Cool visual effects
Endless addictive play
Each game is unique
High-score table
In-game music

Source: The Developer Website.

141455.name: Mini-Golf (2011)
141455.description:
9 Challenging Courses!
Find out if you have what it takes to be a champion golfer. The ultra-realistic simulated mini-golf lets you practice first and than challenge your friends with multi-player Tournament mode. This game is fun to play yet challenging to master. Whether you're a golf enthusiast or just want to pretend, you'll have hours of fun honing your skills while trying to make that hole in one. Tee off in 9 different scenarios:
Haunted House
Race Track
Jungle
Castle
Egypt
Spaceship
Pirate Ship
North Pole
Under The Sea

Features
1 to 4 players
9 different graphical themes
Variable swing force
Best score display
Full 3D camera angles

Source: The Developer Website.

141456.name: Missile Madness
141456.description:
You're the last hope for mankind. In the galaxy's fastest ship, you encounter alien attackers and must annihilate them before they get you. Watch out-the more skilled you become, the faster and smarter they become! Inspired by retro arcade games, 3D Missile Madness features 20 levels of real-time action in three fantasy worlds. Enjoy 3D space arcade action with great sound effects and original music. Bring the action and adventure into your home!

Features
30 Awesome Levels
High-Score Table
Fun casual arcade action

Source: The Developer Website.

141457.name: Mobile Brick Breakers
141457.description:
Brick Breakers is an awesome paddle battle game for your Pocket PC 2000-2002-2003. Destroy the all the bricks to advance to the next level. Use your launch pad to hit the ball. Beware! Enemy robots float around the board and make the game more difficult. A great way to add some excitement to your Pocket PC.

Source: The Developer Website.

141458.name: Atari Pro-Line Joystick
141458.description:
User Summary

The standard controller bundled with Atari 7800 systems sold in the US.

141459.name: EA Sports GamePad
141459.description:
User Summary

A restyled 64 controller produced by InterAct and distributed by Electronic Arts.

141460.description:
Description from the publisher:

Track everyone's levels at once with the Munchkin Level Playing Field, which includes male/female tokens in six colors and matching colored tokens with special in-game benefits for each player! This set also includes four new Munchkin cards! The Level Playing Field also has a second side, with Levels 1-20 for Epic Munchkin!
141460.name: Munchkin Level Playing Field

141461.name: Competition Pro Freedom Connection
141461.description:
Product Box

Infrared Joystick Remote Control


Small, handy portable transmitter for joystick connection



Receiver with connector cable plugs in 1st and 2nd player joystickport of computer or game systems



1st and 2nd player select switch on the transmitter



2 players simultaneous games



Wireless transmitting of all features of the wired joystick via receiver device to the computer



Play up to 15 feet from the computer/TV-screen



Enhances play with automatic rapidfire by select switch on transmitter

141462.name: Control Pad Extension Cord

videogamehwversion.206917: North American Control Pad Extension Cord (Genesis)

141462.description:
User Summary

This 6.5 foot extension cable was designed for the Sega Genesis but will work with other controllers and systems using the same 9-pin format (such as the Atari 2600, Atari 7800 and Vectrex).

141463.name: Guy Spy and the Crystals of Armageddon
141463.description:
Back of Box

Guy Spy is a break-through in adventure gaming featuring full-screen animated characters that are completely under your control! With over 1,500 frames of animation, five megabytes of graphic data and original music and sound effects, Guy Spy sets a new standard in adventure gaming excellence.

You are summoned before the Chief of International Security. "Intelligence reports confirm our worst fears: the evil Baron Von Max has located the legendary Crystals of Armageddon. With the power of the crystals in the hands of this madman, Von Max will have everything he needs to fuel his ultimate weapon of mass-destruction...the doomsday machine."

As Guy Spy you are the government's most trusted and daring counter-espionage agent. You must chase Von Max and his henchmen around the globe in a desperate bid to save the world from his evil plans. If you fail, there is no telling what kind of destruction Von Max will unleash on the world.

Your orders are simple: stop Von Max at any cost... before it's too late!

141464.name: ProController
141464.description:
User Summary

The ProController upgraded the standard Jaguar game pad by adding three additional action buttons.

141465.name: Memory Track

videogamehwversion.206920: North American Atari Jaguar CD Memory Track

141465.description:
Back of Box

Capture your best gaming moments with MEMORY TRACK!

Keep, organize and save important information from Atari Jaguar CD games. With over 125,000 bytes of storage, MEMORY TRACK stores information for up to 250 Jaguar games. Fit MEMORY TRACK into your Jaguar CD Player's cartridge slot and start storing!

You can store:


High Scores--break your own record



Game progress to a specific level--pick up where you left off



Specific character configurations--save the characters you created



Particular levels or worlds--use them later

141466.name: Nuby Sniper
141466.description:
Back of Box

Recoil, Vibration, FirePower!


Vibration Action


Kicks When Firing


Auto-Fire & Auto-Reload


For machine Gun Action


Guncon Compatible


Two Mode Selector Swtich For Guncon & Standard Gun Games


Manual Reload Button


Allows You To Reload Without Shooting Outside The TV Screen


Special Button


For Launching Other Game Weapons

141467.description:
A simpler version of Shogi (or a more complex version of Let's Catch the Lion! (aka Dōbutsu Shōgi or animal shogi), using the illustrations and look of the latter).

Every player has just 8 pieces (3 chicks, 2 cats, 2 dogs and 1 lion) and try to catch the opponents lion. The board is 5x6 squares, so it's a shorter game than regular Shogi, aimed at getting children even more interested in Shogi after they've outgrown the original Dōbutsu Shōgi.

Goro-Goro Dobutsu Shogi not only has a bigger board compared to Dobutsu Shogi, it also adds in some more rules of the full Shogi game:
- Reaching the other side of the board with your lion no longer wins you the game. Only capturing your opponent's lion does.
- You can't have two of your own chicks in the same column/file.
- You can't drop a chick for mate.

Taken from the publisher's website:

The cute animal pieces are now combined with Goro-Goro Shogi, a small shogi on 5x6 square board. This is a very good next step for everyone who has played Dobutsu Shogi.

The rules of Goro-Goro Shogi was invented by Japan Shogi Association, and is widely known to be a very good variation of shogi to learn important concepts in shogi, such as handling the generals effectively, importance of promoting a pawn, and mating the opponent's king with successive piece drops.

Cats and dogs run and play in this small board. Highly recommended. Please have fun!
141467.name: Goro-Goro Dōbutsu Shōgi

141468.name: Magic Sport Kids
141468.description:
Card game published by a German private health care company.

Deal out all the cards. You must play a card to the middle of the table if you can. A legal card to play is any card to a sport if that sport has never been played before. Or a legal play is to play the next card to a card already on the table but the card played must be the number above the sport card you want to play or the one under:
For example:
Let us say that on the table is No. 4 Watersport. A legal play to this card would be the Watersport card numbered 5 or 3. If one of these is played, the next player could play a Watersport card if he chose, provided it was numbered one below or one up again. There is one Champion card which serves as a Joker.

When a card is played by any player, score the points for that player on the card (same as the number) and record this on a score-sheet. The cards rank from 1 to 6 and there are 5 different sports possible in play.

The winner is the first to use all their cards.

141469.name: Castle Garden: Coat of Arms
141469.description:
First expansion for the base game introducing 13 guards per player

Translated from the box:
Your guards take on the opposing army of equally powerful guards in this Castle Garden expansion. Can you outsmart the enemy? Are you faster? Then you have chance to capture the opposing guards.
in this game of attaque and seduction it's a matter of timing and insight.: be too greedy and you might loose your head, too careful and your enemy captures you instead.

Nerves of steel might help you master this expansion of Castle Garden

141470.name: Ich lerne Naturkunde
141470.description:
Young children's educational game.

There are 12 different mini-boards, each consisting of five jigsaw-type pieces. There are five versions of play which can be intended for different age groups. All the games though relate to collecting pieces and forming complete boards. The games range from very simple where the players do little more than to complete 5 mini-boards each. The gameplay is negligible, Mum just piles up the pieces and then the children look for the pieces they are interest in.

And so each game adds a little more gameplay, ending with a game for three players where the pieces are traded back and forth. The winner is still the one who completes their assigned boards first.

rpgitemversion.295301: Le Guide du Front de l'Est

141471.name: Guide to the Eastern Front

rpgissuearticle.169981: Achtung ! Cthulhu - Guide du front de l'Est

141471.description:
From publisher blurb:

HORROR STALKS THE STEPPES!

Achtung! Cthulhu is a terrifying World War Two setting, fully compatible with the Call of Cthulhu, Sixth Edition and Savage Worlds roleplaying games.

Discover the secret history of the war in Russia: a vast land under the thumb of a brutal regime; a downtrodden yet determined population who have seen many horrors, not all of them of man’s making; and a land where giant machines of war rage across the countryside, terrorising all in their path.

The Guide to the Eastern Front adds a new dimension to the Secret War, including:

New investigator occupation templates: play members of the Soviet underworld, political prisoners, NKVD agents, and the cavalry
Information on Russian military structure and the issues faced when waging a war on the Eastern Front
More nameless horrors and vile creatures, such as the Krysolud,
The insects from Shaggai, and the Stalin Lampen
Details on the inner workings of Institute 21, Otdel MI, and the Cult of Red Horus, as well as a variety of independent occult organisations and their nefarious plans for the Soviet Union
Tanks! (including Nachtwölfe’s proposed super tank that puts the Maus and Ratte to shame...)
Stats and rules for use with BOTH Call of Cthulhu 6th Edition AND Savage Worlds in one book!




In fact, a whole dossier’s worth of useful historical and fantastical information to help you expand your campaign out into the wider world of the Secret War.

141472.name: Guide to the Pacific Front
141472.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the secret history of the war beyond Europe: tales of heroic struggles in the Far East and the Pacific Islands; the re-emergence of archaic evils deep within an ancient land; the terrors of jungle warfare, where humans are not the only things stalking you, and the term “wildlife” potentially has a whole new meaning...

The Guide to the Pacific Front adds a new dimension to the Secret War, including:

A variety of new civilian and military character templates
New tomes, weapons, artefacts & equipment]
Even more vile creatures & occult threats
Rules for surviving not only jungle warfare, but the jungle itself
In fact, a whole dossier’s worth of useful historical and fantastical information to help you expand your campaign out into the wider world of the Secret War.
Stats and rules for use with BOTH Call of Cthulhu 6th Edition AND Savage Worlds in one book!

141473.name: Guide to North Africa
141473.description:
From publisher blurb:

Achtung! Cthulhu is a terrifying World War Two setting, fully compatible with the Call of Cthulhu, Sixth Edition and Savage Worlds roleplaying games.

Discover the secret history of the war beyond Western Europe: a land of great antiquity, steeped in legend; a fiery cauldron of political and occult intrigue where the heat is as much your enemy as any man with a gun; and a formidable wilderness where only the strong will survive with their sanity intact.

The Guide to North Africa adds a new dimension to the Secret War, including:

New civilian and military occupation templates: play as an archaeologist, SAS special forces, a Bedouin tribesman, Askari, the LRDG, and the French Foreign Legion
New tomes of forbidden lore, such as the Book of Thoth and the Book of Angels, and yet more summoning spells and protective enchantments
Desert vehicles and equipment, fantastical and mundane (including Nachtwölfe’s latest developments)
Intriguing weapons and artefacts, such as the Atlantean sliver gun, the Yithian Stone Hunter and the Ashes of Sebek
Ancient horrors from the depths of the desert (and space and time): crocodile hybrid mummies, djinn, and the Great Race of Yith
Details on Black Sun’s quest for Irem and Nachtwölfe’s constant search for Atlantean technology
Stats and rules for use with BOTH Call of Cthulhu 6th Edition AND Savage Worlds in one book!

141474.name: Shadows of Atlantis
141474.description:
From the publisher:
Long ago, when the world was young, the citizens of Atlantis stole the secrets of a powerful technology from their enemies and used it to wage a great war, in the process sealing their own terrible fate. Now, on the eve of what promises to be another world altering war, the strange theories of René Guenon and Julius Evola have been given a boost by the discovery of strange writings in Berlin and Tibet. Nachtwölfe, Hitler’s technology-obsessed research and defence unit, are convinced these documents hold the secret of where the fleeing Atlanteans took their wonderful weaponry and are determined to find them.

Covering five continents, the Shadows of Atlantis campaign takes investigators on a globe-spanning mission to unravel the clues locked in the ancient writings and recover the lost technology before the forces of darkness can repeat the mistakes of Atlantis and destroy the world they know. Part One covers Europe and North Africa as the investigators are drawn into a web of intrigue and insanity. Part Two visits India and Persia as the stakes grow ever higher, and in Part Three the investigators must survive the jungles of South America and the frozen wastes of Greenland to face the terrifying climax of their quest…

141475.name: Assault on the Mountains of Madness
141475.description:
From the publisher:
Following a trail of strange events, and clues to an ill-fate earlier expedition, the Allies will discover an Antarctic infested with Nazis. They must launch themselves into the frozen continent where they’ll be faced with the power of the elements, unbelievable ancient mysteries and a stunning climax that could change the face of the world forever. Artwork by Korungn and cartography by Michal. E. Cross.
“Join us for this dangerous expedition, some of you will not return, but I know every one of you will give your lives before letting the Third Reich raise the Swastika over this accursed ultimate abyss.” Captain Brandon Carter, Assault on the Mountains of Madness

141476.name: Terrors of the Secret War

rpghonor.27855: 2015 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Nominee

141476.description:
From the publisher:
This 128 page book unlocks a world of pain for your Investigators. Giant terrors, vast Nazi war machines, Mythos creatures and Elder Gods re-imagined in the Achtung! Cthulhu universe with stunning colour & B&W art. You'll also find regional Mythos gargantuan's to go with the regional Guides. Not just a monstrous compendium - Terrors of the Secret War will provide plots to introduce each of the Terror's and new rules to allow your Investigator's to try to take on these ancient or epic scale foes!

141477.name: The Game of Boy Scouts
141477.description:
An old track game that depicts the players rise through the Boy Scouts. Players start at "start here" location on the outer circle track. After spinning, player move the indicated amount. The first player, reaches the center space on the board win the game.
Beautifully color illustrated 18½" x 18½" game board, with four colored wooden pieces and two cardboard spinners with metal arrows. The original instructions were printed on the underside of the cover.

The game board contains 100, 1-3/8" colored circles, most showing boys working their way up from Tenderfoot through the stages of Scouting. The term "Eagle Scout" badge was in existence for only one year before this game was issued which is probably why it's not listed. 57 Merit Badges were available to choose from. These are listed in the text-circles. Each corner provides a detailed illustration of some facet of scouting. The exterior of the board is pressed with scrollwork in all eight corners.
The 20" x 10" box itself is wooden and lined with a textured leather-like material.

141478.name: Silben-Memo
141478.description:
There are cards with different animals and syllables with set of three f.e. gi-raf-fe.
Who first finds all three syllables and sets the animal names together gets the cards.
Player with the most sets is the winner.

141479.name: Night Caster II: Equinox
141479.description:
From the back of the box:

Eternal darkness has once again taken over the land.

Invoke enchanting spells that will release the power of light over the oppression of darkness and defeat the minions unleashed by the executor of evil. You are the last hope to save this suffering land before night claims it forever.


Wage war against the creatures of the night with the combination melee combat and spell system.



Spread your magical prowess with the Dual Analog Control system - move in one direction, fire spells in a different direction.



Adventure with another spellcaster in multiplayer and work together to defeat the darkness.



The interactive Music Score matches the tempo and intensity of each exciting event that unfolds.



Vibrant graphics will make each adventure a breath taking experience of light and color.

141480.name: Remnants: The Broken Lands
141480.description:
From back of book:
Remnants: The Broken Lands is the first expansion for the Remnants role-playing game.

Explore the slave city of Amantin, the chaotic Broken Hills, and the most dangerous places you can imagine. Inside you will find setting information, NPC and monster stats, new optional rules, and brand new traits for your Battle Remnants.

In a broken land, in a broken future, fight for what’s left.

141481.name: The Times Su Doku
141481.description:
The Times Su Doku is a tile placement game which allows either solo puzzle solving or two player competitive game play. Su Doku (or Sudoku) is a mathematical puzzle which consists of a grid of 9 3x3 squares. The completed puzzle has the digits 1 to 9 in each 3x3 square and the digits 1 to 9 in each row and column in the grid. The game poses a number of partially complete grids which must be completed correctly and can be used in either the solo puzzle or two player game.

The solo mode allows a player to attempt to correctly complete a Su Doku. This function of the set is not technically a game and is actually solo puzzle solving.

The two player mode sees both players attempting to complete the same puzzle in the same grid. Players may place a tile as soon as they are sure that the placement is correct; there is no turn sequence. The players race to place as many correct tiles as possible before the whole puzzle is complete. The winning player is the one who placed the largest number of correct tiles in the puzzle, less the number of incorrect tiles which they placed. The tiles are double sided and are printed with a different colour on each side to allow players to identify which tiles were placed by which player.

141482.name: Real War
141482.description:
Front cover of the Official Field Manual for Real War.

Real-time strategy with the weapons of today's military. Real War: Air-Land-Sea. Based on the official Joint Chiefs of Staff training game developed for the U.S. military.

141483.name: No Good Gremlins
141483.description:
It's Rocket Festival in Junktown! This is the time of year when the mayor awards medals to everyday folks for building and launching rockets using the abundant scrap lying around town. Everyone loves Rocket Festival, but no one loves it more than those hungry little gremlins. That's because there are tons of tasty rockets to munch! As soon as you think you have a prize-winning rocket, a horde of ravenous gremlins just might sweep through and leave you with nothing! So launch those rockets fast, because when the festival ends, who ever has the best medal collection wins!

No Good Gremlins is a family card game for two to five players. Use your turn to start construction on new rockets or build up the ones you already have. Completed rockets can be launched for points, but the bigger the rocket, the more points it will earn. Be careful though! The longer you wait to launch a rocket, the greater the chance it will be eaten by gremlins.

141484.name: Scorpion
141484.description:
Game Box

Recoil Jolt Action Light Gun for your PlayStation


Auto Fire
Auto Re-Load
G-Con/Guncon Compatible
Recoil Jolt Action

141485.name: Memory Rocker Pack
141485.description:
User Summary

A combination vibration and memory card unit for the Nintendo 64. Features include battery-free operation and (on the Rocker Pak +) four user selectable internal memory cards.

Box Text - Memory Rocker Pak +

4 Times More Memory

256K X 4 1MB

UNLIMITED PLAYING TIME!

No Batteries Needed!

Advanced Memory Rocker Pak + does not need any batteries.


Designed specifically for NINTENDO 64.
No batteries required, unlimited playing time.
1 MB MEMORY CARD included, 4 different pages of Save, total of 460 pages.
No external power required; low power consumption from the game console
For all games with Rumbler option

141486.name: Sicher auf dem Fahrrad
141486.description:
Children's game intended to teach road safety, particularly for young cyclists.

The board reflects a ride through town and ends where you started from. A dice is used for movement but has some choices if you are lucky. If you roll an arrow, you can advance up to 4 spaces. If you roll a card, you draw a card and another player asks you the question. If you are correct, you can move up to 6 spaces. If you roll the pedestrian, you can move him. He is an extra piece on the board and can 'walk' from zebra crossing to zebra crossing. If he is on a crossing when your piece arrives before it, you cannot go over the crossing until the pedestrian has been moved elsewhere.

The first player to arrive home, wins.

One nice touch is that the question cards can be sorted in to four levels of difficulty, so the game can happily be played by various age groups.

141487.name: Pro Extension Cable
141487.description:
User Summary

A controller extension cable for the Nintendo 64.

Back of Box


6.5 ft cord for greater playing for N64



Distance and freedom of movement



A necessary accessory for all N64

141488.description:
Surge is a promotional card and can be used with the ApocalypZe Card Game base set.
This card was given out at PAX East - Boston, March 22-24, 2013
(Boston Convention & Exhibition Center)

Text on card:
Surge
"I got one!" "Good! Now get the other fifty"

If you have a horde in play, draw 4 cards.
141488.name: ApocalypZe Card Game: Surge Promo

141489.name: SuperPad 64

videogamehwversion.206966: North American Performance SuperPad 64 Colors, Blue

141489.description:
User Summary

A line of aftermarket Nintendo 64 controllers marketed by InterAct. The SuperPad uses the same basic button and stick layout as the standard N64 controller, but in a differently shaped controller body (covered with a rubberized texture in some models).

Box Text for Prism Color Series SuperPad 64

The SuperPad 64 features a remarkable new "stingray" shaped design allowing for easy analog control during gameplay. Featuring five fire buttons, view control, eight-way digital direction control and a steel analog joystick shaft the SuperPad provides comfort, control, precision and durability!

Cool SharkSkin Feel Provides Maximum Comfort

141491.name: Mountain Master
141491.description:
Wacky Mountain Adventures!
Aliens have invaded Clem's beloved wilderness home and used their technology to control the animals. Clem must collect diamonds on each level to release animals from alien mind control.
Puzzling Terrain!
Each scrolling level presents a multi-layered challenge. You will climb peaks and slide down slopes. Tunnels can send you to the other end of the level. Water, trees, and rocks stand in your way, but with a little determination, you'll find a way past these obstacles.
Grab Your Tools!
With the right equipment, you can raft across lakes, chop down trees, or climb steep slopes. But you can only carry one tool at a time, so hopefully you'll have a plan! It definitely pays to pick the right tool for the job.
All Creatures Great and Small!
Snakes, hawks, and bears will be chasing you (or maybe just bumping into you in a bad way). Sometimes you just need to stay away from them, but other times you need their help. Under the alien's mind control, the animals move in predictable ways. You can plan routes for them by carefully pushing crates into their path.
Aliens!
The aliens have installed their contraptions all over the place. There are strange buttons, doors, and even cloning devices. You may meet the aliens themselves, although they certainly prefer not to be seen.

Source: The Developer Website.

141492.name: Team Tap Multi-Player Adapter

videogamehwversion.206969: North American Team Tap Multi-Player Adapter

141492.description:
Box Text

Multi-Player Adapter for the Atari Jaguar 64-Bit Interactive Entertainment System. Tap into multi-player fun for up to 4 players.


The Jaguar Team Tap allows up to 4 players to play compatible Jaguar games.



With 2 Team Tap adapters, play with up to 8 players!



Jaguar Team Tap is compatible with most Jaguar controllers, including the standard 3-Button Contgroller and the Jaguar 6-Button Pro Controller.

141493.name: Ord på ord
141493.description:
This letter tile game has been described as a mix between Tetris and Scrabble. 48 tiles are drawn in a random sequence and "dropped" into a slanted 7x7 playing field with the goal of creating as many and as long words as possible, horizontally and vertically. The 49th joker tile is available to be dropped at any time.

After its original release, the game has been implemented several times as computer games and web applications (often but not always titled WOW: Word on Word), with seeded tile sequences to facilitate competitive play.

141494.name: Musical Memory Machine
141494.description:
A great memory game! Watch the flashing lights and patterns carefully, because you will have to repeat them back to the computer. See how long you can last in this intensly fun memory game!

Features
1 and 2 player modes
Different skill levels
Digital sound effects and music
Different graphical scenarios

Source: The Developer Website.

141495.name: UltraRacer 64
141495.description:
Box Text

The UltraRacer 64 mini hand-held steering controller features Analog Steering with Ten Fire Buttons. To maximize your control, the Button Relocation Function lets you customize buttons to perform actions of any other button. The Throttle Control Trigger on the backside of the controller allows precision movement and ease of handling. A Controller Pak slot is available to save all of your game statistics and data. The Ultra Racer 64 meets the demand of the most challenging Nintendo 64 games available!


Ten Fire Buttons



View Control



Button Relocation Function



Analog Steering



Throttle Control Trigger



LED Display



Controller Pak Slot



Extra Long Cord


Rumble Pak and TremorPak compatible

141496.name: Video Touch Pad
141496.description:
User Summary

A 12-button keypad controller that accepted game-specific overlays. Commonly referred to as the Star Raiders Controller as it was released in conjunction with the Atari 2600 release of that game.

141497.name: My Little Pony: Crystal Princess – The Runaway Rainbow

videogameversion.206974: North American Game Boy Advance edition

141497.description:
A Rainbow Filled Adventure Awaits You! Everyone in Unicornia is celebrating the season's first rainbow when RARITY THE UNICORN accidentally transports herself to Breezie Blossom. Go on an adventure to bring her home for the rainbow celebration! Meet all of the Ponies and Breezies as you follow the story of the newest My Little Pony DVD movie! Play 14 fun mini-games throughout your adventure, including memory matching, dress up games & more! Explore 5 exciting levels including Breezie Blossom, Ponyville and Unicornia.
Features

Meet Rarity the Unicorn!
Explore Unicornia
14 awesome mini-games
5 levels to explore
Awesome Music and sound effects

Source: The Developer Website.

141498.name: My Little Pony: Pinky Pie's Party
141498.description:
Play 8 mini games to uncover the hidden presents. Making Music with Star Song, Toola Roola Decorates for the Party, Bubble Pop with Sweetie-Bell and many more! Unwrap Pinkie Pie's presents using the Nintendo DS® stylus and keep what's inside to play with at anytime. Blow the Nintendo DS® microphone to make special birthday presents come alive including a whistle, a pinwheel, a bubble maker and many more! Explore Ponyville as you search for the hidden puzzle pieces to play the puzzle mini game and create a fabulous group picture of all the Ponies.

Features
Collect and unwrap presents
Explore Ponyville
8 Mini-games!
Microphone input.
Awesome Music and sound effects

Source: The Developer Website.

141499.name: Tank Commander (1995)
141499.description:
Back of Box

Blast your friends to pieces.

In the real world of armored warfare, a tank commander's split-second decisions can make the difference between life and death. This exciting MULTI-PLAYER SIMULATION is no different: All the action happens in real time! Unlike other strategy games, there are no turns--only furious, lifelike combat. It's fast, fun and easy to start playing. But it's so addictive, you won't be able to stop.

Command a platoon of the deadliest machines in modern warfare, including the T-72, M1 Abrams, Leopard and Challenger. Order airstrikes by your squadrons of A-IO Warthogs or Gazelle and Apache gunships. Embark on dozens of missions around the world, from broiling deserts and frigid arctic tundra to crowded cities and dense jungles. Difficulty levels increase as you progress through the game. Full motion video makes you feel like you're really there in the middle of the action! Play solo against the computer. Go head-to-head against a friend over a modem. For the ultimate combat experience, get on an IPX-protocol network and battle to the death against up to three other players!

[Photo Captions]

Tank Commander features multiple views, including this one from the turret--where you stare eyeball-to-eyeball with a nasty T-72!

For multi-player action, use a modem to play against a buddy, or better yet, get on a network and challenge as many as three other players!

A simple keystroke puts you behind the yoke of any three tanks in your armored unit, so you can watch the action from different positions.

Tank Commander is a multi-vehicle combat simulation that includes tanks, Gazelle and Apache helicopters, A-10 Warthogs--and even submarines!

The game includes over 40 challenging missions and will test your skill and courage against airborne enemy craft like the Apache gunship.

Stunning texture-mapped graphics enhance the realism and intensity of battle, as does the inclusion of several landmarks such as Stonehenge.

If war is hell, then it can be a very cold hell--missions can take you to nontraditional battlegrounds such as this conflict in the arctic tundra.

As commander, call in your own squadron of tank-busting A-10 Warthogs to thwart enemy advances in desert-based missions.

141500.name: My Little Pony: Pinkie Pie's Party Parade
141500.description:
Product Description

Have a great time in Ponyville! Join Pinkie Pie as she travels through Ponyville, playing with her favorite ponies in preparation for the Ponyville Birthday Party Parade.

-Play with 7 favorite ponies including Tula Rula, Pinkie Pie and Rainbow Dash!
-10 exciting pony games and activities including Dancing Days, Magic Star Show and Pony Bowling.
-Make the best pretty pink tiara to be worn by the secret birthday pony.
-Help Rainbow Dash get dressed for the Ponyville Birthday Party Parade.

141002.name: Take-A-Break! Pinball for Windows
141002.description:
From the back of the case to the Jewel Case edition

"EIGHT BALLS OF FIRE

Eight big games give you eight ways to play!
Take-A-Break! Pinball puts 8 full-featured pinball games at the tip of your mouse clicking finger. Each one challenges your skill in all new ways. It's Windows compatible - so you can jump from work to play in a nanosecond!

Amazingly real pinball action!
Experience the thrills and skills of the big arcade machines: fast bumper bouncing ball action, tilts, grunching, and sizzling sound (including speech). You can even have three balls in play at once! Arcade action and a whole lot more! Animated playfield graphics interact with your game play and make your game come alive."

141003.name: Kroz Free
141003.description:
User Summary

The complete Kroz series (produced in the late 1990s) was released as Freeware by 3D Realms in 2009 for download in Windows. All of the Kroz games have been included, as well as notes from the developers, a hints file that can be implemented into the games, the source code, and informative readme files.

Kroz games follow the story of an archaeologist searching for gems and other treasures in a series of underground caverns. Monsters are attracted to his every movement, though they can be fended off using whips, which are of a one time use.

141006.name: Triple Crown
141006.description:
Triple Crown is a trick taking game for 4 players that can be played with a regular deck of cards. Players play individually, but temporary alliances with occur.

There are three possible ways to score points. Which of these three goals you need to achieve is determined by the cards you are dealt. The player who is dealt the Ace of Spades will be trying to win 5 tricks playing alone. He/she is known as the High player. The player who is dealt the Two of Diamonds also plays alone and will be trying to go nil (lose every trick). He/she is known as the Low player. The two players who were dealt neither the Ace of Spades nor the Two of Diamonds are on a team for the hand. The team players will score points by preventing the High and Low players from achieving their goals.

Whether you are the High player, Low player, or on the Team will be secret at the beginning of the hand. What goal you are trying to achieve is only revealed through play. Therefore keep a poker face and play smart. Be quiet and unreadable or loud and deceiving.

This is a fun and exciting game for all skill levels. Easy to learn rules and play for beginners. Plenty of strategic depth for more experienced players to master.

141007.description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etc. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

This new Big Box contains the base game, plus the most popular of the expansions: Inns & Cathedrals, Traders and Builders, Princess & Dragon, Abbey & Mayor, and Bridges, Castles, & Bazaars.
141007.name: Carcassonne Big Box 3

141008.description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

This Big Box is the same size of the previous, but with a slightly different component mix. This big box includes the basic game, Inns & Cathedrals, Traders & Builders, Princess & Dragon, Abbey & Mayor, River 2, Count, King, and Cult.
141008.name: Carcassonne Big Box 2

141009.description:
Shattered Throne is the second expansion to the Planet Masters dicegame. This optional set of rules explains how to use the new dice.

Background story:

With order restored, diplomacy now reigns. Politicians are on their apex of power. Discussion and consensus now decide almost each and every action that happens in the galaxy. The claws of diplomacy hold entire empires in their grasp.
141009.name: Stars of Hope

141010.name: Evoland
141010.description:
Evoland is a game and a story. The story of action adventure gaming as seen in the Zelda or Final Fantasy series, starting with the early age of action RPGs, when a few pixels were enough to make us dream for hours. New players will discover a bit of video game history and a very fun gameplay, and veterans will also enjoy a host of references to legendary titles scattered along the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor.22020: 2013 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee

141011.name: Mad Dogs with Guns
141011.description:
From the publiher's website:

Mad Dogs With Guns is a miniatures game set in the “Roaring Twenties”—the wide-open era of Prohibition, Tommy Guns and concrete overshoes. It’s about mad-dog mobsters, crooked cops, and the kind of liquor that can send you blind for weeks. It’s about fast cars and faster women, paid-off politicians and basement breweries, private eyes and public enemies. But mostly it’s about men with silk suits, snap-brim fedoras and automatic weapons, quarrelling violently.

User Summary
In this game, two to four gangs of mobsters fight against each other. Each figure is assign specific stats according to its category, such as Punk, Slugger or Enforcer. During the game, the order of action is determined by a deck of cards. Each gang is assigned a suit. All the cards from those suits are shuffled, and drawn one-by-one.

Each time a card is drawn, one member of the matching gang is allowed to take to actions, such as move, shoot, aim or recover. When a court card is drawn, all members of that gang are allowed to act.

If a player does not want to perform an action, he can hold the card, and use it to interrupt another player later on in the game.

141013.description:
Fast-paced letter-dice game.
Each turn the category-card is drawn and the dice are rolled.
Who forms first the word in this category containing the rolled letters gets the card as a point.

The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
141013.name: Wirbelwörter

141014.description: Creative cardplay for young and old storytellers. "Whoever digs a pit for others, has gold in the mouth", so goes a famous saying. But wait, that's so not so! In this game, there are 60 playing cards with the first part of the sentence. Now we have to ponder what might these strange sentences. Because the players determine which answer they like best - and who scores.
141014.name: Sprücheklopfer

141015.description:
There are a game board with 5 x 5 grid, each player tries to make as many words with the letters, and especially so long words as possible by placing the tiles on the grid. That would be easy if you could choose the letters for yourself. But that is only once per round. All other times the letters are provided by the fellow opponents.
Words scores points and player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner
141015.name: Verfünft!

141016.description: Includes current standard size share certificates for 1825.
141016.name: 1825 Conversion Kit C1: Share Certificates

141017.name: Tajemnice Krainy Ducha Gór
141017.description:
Tajemnice Krainy Ducha Gór is an educational game about places of touristic interest around Jelenia Góra. Players are tourist guides competing to take their groups to most interesting places, while their actions are limited by cards in hand and time tokens they are given.

The game deck consists of two types of cards: sightseeing places and interesting facts. Places make up the trip each player's group takes and are a basis for scoring, while facts can add to the score or even (when played at a correct place) can multiply it.
