Varp also works (it's an acronym for video-augmented role-playing). Interestingly enough, varp is the Icelandic word for 'projection.'

In this game, four players portray members of a starship crew. They are in great peril. There is no game master (GM) and there are no dice.

The entire game is played in-character from start to finish.

141098.name: Captain's Log #38
141098.description:
Basics: 120 pages, 6 scenarios, 23 new SSD.

From the back cover:

Into The Vortex
The Lyran cruiser Doomward is sent to investigate an inversion vortex. Spatial rifts of this type appear every few years, and create a wormhole to ... another galaxy? another time? another universe? No one know for sure, the ship may not even be able to tell which side of the vortex it is on!

Communications: Command the Future, Conventions & Aces, Why?, After Action Reports, Starline 2400, Input Guide, and more.

Federation Commander: Ships, Scenarios, Tactics, and the Borders of Madness.

New Ships: Bases for Early Years Romulans, two new federation Cruisers and a Heavy Carrier, the Hydran Templar you never saw, Armed Recovery Transport.

Venues: Galactic Conquest, Star Fleet Warlord, SFB (and FC) On-Line, Commando Ships for Star Fleet Battle Force.

Database: Arastoz Combines, Lyran Brothers of the Anarchist, Romulan Early Bases, Background Questions and Admiral Growler.

Tactics: Tactical Primer, Term Papers, Battle Group stops the Juggernaut.

Scenarios: After the Ambush, Deathblossom, Unfortunate Encounter, Take Me to the Circus, Wabbit Season, Melting Rocks with Plasma.

Federation & Empire: Tactical Notes, Altered Alliances, Minesweepers, ComPot Shock.

141099.name: Captain's Log #19
141099.description:
Basic Data: 112 pages, 5 scenarios, 25 new SSDs.things

From the back cover:

A Kzinti History of the General War. They did not see it in the way the Federation did. Plus an analysis of the Lyran political system; Romulan insigna.

Database: Command the Future, Conventions, Why?, Ask Kommodore Ketrick, After Action Reports, Scratch Force 600, Proposal Board, and more.

New Ships: 16 New ships including new ideas and new races; ships for Omega.

Tactics: Victory and defeat are detailed in articles and Term Papers by experts.

Brothers of the Anarchist: How to conver any Klingon ship into Hydran, and any Hydran ship into the Deep Space Fleet! Hot campaign info!

Universe: The Yitlians in Prime Directive, Winning at Warlord, Vudar Update.

Venues: Surviving Star Fleet Command, Galactic Conquest, Warlord tactics, Holding the Line in SFB On-Line, PBEM Report.

Miniatures Return: Five new pewter starships blast their way into the Star Fleet Universe.

Scenarios: The Masters send their toys into the Asteroid Field of Death; Diplomats, Scientists, and Warriors clash over pride, knowledge, and survival; is the Romulan colonial governor a Patriot or a Traitor?

Federation & Empire: Fed & Enquire, Dozens of Tactical Notes, Total War Update, The Second Federation-Klingon War.

141100.name: Captain's Log #27
141100.description:
Basics: 112 pages, 2 scenarios, 16 new SSD.

From the back cover:

Death Rattle!: The General Wart is over, but a new conflict is set to begin as the Andromedan invaders attack the planet Rimworld, home to Gorn and Federation colonies. As a squadron sacrifices itself to buy time, fast cruisers, X-ships, and even Romulans race to the scene as a Kzinti commando boards the Dominator.

Class History of the Federation Fast Cruisers and Light Dreadnoughts, Hydran military decorations, and a map of the Milky Way Galaxy locating Alpha, Omega, and the Xorkaelians.

Communications: Command the Future, announces new products, Conventions & Aces, Why?, Admiral Growler punishes the weak, After Action Reports, Starline 2400, Input Guide, More.

'New Ships: ISC contingency ships with four hulls! The Frax Battle Line expands with the heavy dreadnought, light dreadnought, fast cruiser, and patrol carrier.The Light Modular DreadnoughtStar Lynx, the Fleet Scout 'Eagle. Gorns turn destroyers into cruisers with huge new rear hulls.

Venues: Starfleet Command, Galactic Conquest, Warlord tactics, SFB On-Line, PBEM.

Database: Batle Group fights the Carrier Campaign, Deck plans for two ships, Federation-vs-Romulan Brothers of the Anarchist, Lyrans for Star Fleet Battle Force, DEFSAT example.

Tactics: Victory at Origins 2003, Auroran Tactical Primer, Term Papers by the top players.

Scenarios: Romulans, Gorns, Andromedans and the Federation clash in a wild Melee at Rimworld. Federation bombers defend a planet against the Orions.

Federation & Empire: Rules & Rulings, Four Pages of Tactical Notes, Combined Operations, Rules and Rulings, the Origins wish list, Ship Information Table, new rules for F&E.

141101.name: Captain's Log #20
141101.description:
Basics: 112 pages, 5 scenarios, 20 new SSD.

From the back cover:

On Unlucky Starship!: The Dreadnought Dominion finds three different monsters in the same area over a 15-years period, and they were all dangerous. The Black Hole Asteroid Gun was a Federation secret weapon that went berzerk. The Artifact Entitydrove crews insane and attacked ships. Space Lens was a monster - from the Andromeda Galaxy!

Communications: Command the Future, Conventions & Aces, Why?, Kommodore Ketrick lays down the Law, After Action Report, Proposal Board, Squadron Majors, Input Guide, and more.

New Ships: 20 New ships including Omega Freighters, a new race from the Magellanic Cloud, Klingon ships of the Middle Years, and Kzinti Light Cruiser variants.

Term Papers: by the aces and expert improve your game. Victory On-line!

Cool Pins: The first in a new series are to be released at Origins!

Database: Omega ships and tactics, the new Uthiki race, Battle force 600tries to Stop the Death Probe, An Example of Black Hole movement, Prime Directive, Gorn and Romulan Brothers of the Anarchist, Murphy's Laws.

Venues: StarFleet Command, SFB On-Line, PBEM Report, Galactic Conquest.

Scenarios: A "Choise of Monsters". the Andros leave the Uthiki A "Rational Choise", the Trobrins encounter a Mæsron "Convoy Surprise", Orions and Klingons clash along the Kzinti border in "Death to Spies", and "Salvage Your Luck".

141102.description:
In DuCo, players score points by playing cards so that colored icons lie next to one another. If you match color or shape, you score; match both, and you score more; match special symbols, and the bonus points will roll in. Some icons will match any color or shape, giving you more opportunities to score. The options for where to play grow each turn, and the first player to reach 50 points wins!

Too simple for a veteran BGG user? Don't count on it until you've tried the alternative game modes that adds new different strategic elements to the color-matching madness!
141102.name: DuCo

141103.name: Grim Portents (Issue 1 - Apr 2013)
141103.description:
from the first page

This is the first issue of Grim Portents, a fanzine for the Dungeon World tabletop roleplaying game. It was edited by Chris Sakkas and released in April 2013.

141105.name: Up Down
141105.description: Japanese Old Game. Players take turns rolling two dice an putting coins onto the hollow spaces of a balancing see-saw. The game is over when all coins have been placed, and the winner is the person who has the balance tipped to his or her side.

141106.name: ASYNC Corp.

videogamehonor.32224: 2012 IGF Awards Best Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

141106.description:
User Summary

ASYNC Corp. is a puzzle game where the player is a worker at the title company, whose job is to assemble and ship packets by rearranging colored Units. The Packets must be rectangles or squares consisting of four or more blocks. To create a Packet, the player swaps Units from the opposite side of the screen; Units can only be swapped if it would create a Packet on one of the two sides. The game has several modes:


Quota mode
ASYNC mode
colorZoning mode
Freeplay mode


Leveling up is based on performance, with new color themes added with each promotion.

141107.name: Anno Domini: Avvenimenti bizzarri
141107.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year in which it happened on the other.
Each player receives nine of these cards, and may only look at the descriptions. Each player in turn puts a card on the table, trying to put them in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.
Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure and are hard to date.

Avvenimenti bizzarri is part of the Anno Domini series for the italian market. The theme of the cards revolves around bizarre and strange historical events. It can be played as a stand alone game or it can be integrated with other Anno Domini series cards.

141108.name: Dungeons of Kroz
141108.description:
In Game Description

On each level, you try to avoid the monsters, and stock up on the gems and whips that you need to survive. (One or more gems are lost every time you hit a monster, and if you lose all your gems, you die on the next hit; the whip can clear away monsters and crumbled walls in your way.) You may also find other useful things, like keys to unlock doors. At the bottom of the dungeon, a great treasure awaits for the daring and skillful adventurer who makes it.

You can save a game in progress in order to resume after an interruption or have several tries at a tough level without retracing all previous levels.
However, only the status as of the beginning of the current level is saved; anything you did after you entered the level won't be saved. You've got to make it to the end of the level and save again for your later gains to be preserved.

141109.name: Castle of Kroz
141109.description:
In Game Description

CASTLE OF KROZ is a game of exploration and survival. The journey will take you through 20 dangerous chambers riddled with diabolical traps and hideous creatures. Hidden in the deepest dungeon lies the priceless Crown of Kroz - your quest. Use the numeric keypad to move the player in eight different directions.

The chambers contain treasures, spells, traps, and other dangers. The object of CASTLE OF KROZ is to collect as much treasure as possible while advancing to the highest levels. Touching an object for the first time will reveal a little of its identity (a description is displayed at the bottom of the screen), but you must decide how best to use or avoid an object.

141110.name: Caverns of Kroz II
141110.description:
User Summary

Caverns of Kroz II is the sequel to Cavern of Kroz, which is, itself, another installment in the Kroz series. In Kroz games, the player controls an archaeologist in search of a particular item of value which is unique to each game.
Fantasy creatures are warded off with whips that must be collected, else the character loses the collected gems and then eventually dies.

141111.name: Dungeons of Kroz II
141111.description:
User Summary

On each level, you try to avoid the monsters, and stock up on the gems and whips that you need to survive. (One or more gems are lost every time you hit a monster, and if you lose all your gems, you die on the next hit; the whip can clear away monsters and crumbled walls in your way.) You may also find other useful things, like keys to unlock doors. At the bottom of the dungeon, a great treasure awaits for the daring and skillful adventurer who makes it.

You can save a game in progress in order to resume after an interruption or have several tries at a tough level without retracing all previous levels. However, only the status as of the beginning of the current level is saved; anything you did after you entered the level won't be saved. You've got to make
it to the end of the level and save again for your later gains to be preserved.

141112.name: Kingdom of Kroz II
141112.description:
User Summary

Kingdom of Kroz II is a continuation of the original Kroz game: Kingdom of Kroz. The player is an archaeologist in search of precious gems and legendary relics; however, beasties from the dark caverns are bent on preventing the item's removal. They must be fended off with disposable whips.

141113.name: Shrine of Kroz
141113.description:
User Summary

Shrine of Kroz is another installment in the Kroz series of games, featuring the same nameless archaeologist intent on delving into the ancient world of Kroz in search of precious gems and artifacts. Evil monsters lurk and must be warded off with whips, else the character perishes.

141115.name: Erst denken dann lenken
141115.description:
Players start with their 4 pawns at the 4 corners of the board. They roll the dice and decide to advance with one of their pawns. At the beginning, each player is provided with 10 traffic signs. At the end of any move, a player is entitled to place one of his traffic signs near a space. According to the traffic sign, a pawn can be blocked, forced to move slower or take another route. A player who disobeys a sign must answer a question from the rule book about traffic rules. When all 4 pawns of a player arrive in the central parking lot, that player wins.

Content:
board, 120 traffic signs, 2 dice, 16 pawns, catalogue of questions

produced (but not published) by ASS

141116.name: Wall-e: Un cadeau pour Ève
141116.description:
It's a Wikinder evolution featuring the little robot of the famous movie.
Each player tries to clean the planet, collecting rubbish along the 7 continents and bringing it to the central rubbish tip, where it will be converted into beautiful coloured cubes. The one who is be able to collect the greatest number of cubes can try to conquer the heart of the little female robot Eva.

141117.name: Commoners & Non-Magickal Skills
141117.description:
From Introduction:

In the war-ridden realm of Anhelm, occasional commoners still eke out an existence in hiding. If your ongoing game of EAK features these sad souls, you’ll need rules to whip them up, although they should pose very little threat to a wizard (no more than an angry dog). You can even the playing field some, so check out the extra section below on adding non-magickal skills to your game.

141118.name: Construct Creation: Alternate Rules
141118.description:
From Introduction:

The following are reworked rules for creating constructs and magical beasts. These rules are altered versions of those appearing in the EAK rulebook, but they may be a bit clearer and allow for better custom creations.

141119.name: St. Joseph's Furnace
141119.description:
From Introduction:

Embedded in a tall, rocky spire, St. Joseph’s Furnace is an unused forge in which the iconic religious wizard, Joseph Caliga, created many mysterious artifacts. In old days, the spire was only accessible by way of a thin staircase spiraling up to the entrance. After Joseph disappeared, the forge was guarded by a small sect of faithful followers but remains abandoned.

141120.name: The Library of Ezz
141120.description:
From Introduction:

The ancient Library of Ezz is considered lost to this day. During the Breaking of Anhelm, many wizards gave up hope of discovering the treasured resource. The wanton destruction would have wiped out any remaining worth from the library, as the texts, scrolls, and tomes within were already thousands of years old.

The great wizard, Ezz, carved the library deep beneath a nameless mountain. There, he painstakingly stored tomes of knowledge, wisdom, lore, and power, foreseeing a time when such resources might be rare. A handful of wizards even had the opportunity to study at the library, although Ezz guarded his trove quite jealously. The location remained a mystery, for Ezz was bound by his maniacal devotion to preserve, not share, the knowledge he amassed.

In reality, the library survived, due to Ezz’s magickal prowess. Unfortunately, it is now scattered in four wings, so a wizard who discovers one must still search for the others.

141121.name: Necromancers: Brotherhood of Death
141121.description:
From Introduction:

“Here me, for I speak true! They are coming and there is nothing anyone can do to stop them. They are the Mortis-Fraternas, and they are coming. They are Death! Its harbingers, its keepers, its master! While we endlessly squabble over the ashen remains of Anhelm, they are gathering power. For every wizard that falls, one more is added to their legions. They are coming! They are going to kill everything. They claim that Anhelm is the realm of Death, and they are the rightful keepers! By the Power, They are coming! We are all going to die…”
-Final words of Magnus the Mighty after his return from Mount Necronus

Deep in the bowels of Mount Necronus, resided the Mortis-Fraternas, the Brotherhood of Death. They are more commonly known as Necromancers. The Brotherhood is a loosely allied enclave of death wizards whose sole purpose to transform Anhelm into a mass-graveyard filled with only death and the undead. To
achieve this goal, the brothers pour over forbidden tomes and demon-lore to uncover dark secrets hidden away long ago. To achieve the Brotherhood’s goals, no ritual is too dark, no demon too evil, no price too high. For the Necromancers, Death is the only path.

141122.name: The Truth Behind Rings of Power
141122.description:
From Introduction:

From the Desk of Bayando the Brainy
On This Day, 6 Years Since the Breaking

WITH THE LACK of proper information available to my colleagues across (what is left of) Anhelm, I am often the first sought out for the trustworthy answers to their burning questions. Wizards know that I possess much knowledge of things arcane and mundane. I have a reputation in this regard. When other wizards spent their summer breaks riding on dragons made of lightning or wooing the island girls of Lacya with their fiery magickal displays of manhood, I was reading, absorbing, and digesting the fabulous collection of books at the Magickal Mysterium Center for Intelligent Spellcasters.

Oh, even now, to think of it... how I miss it. What a treasure we have lost to the ravages of vile heathens and unbridled magickal power. Imagine if that vast repertoire of knowledge was available today! Such wisdom, such vision, such meticulously catalogued greatness - surely, we wizards would not be in the mess we are in now.

141123.name: Shapeshifting: A New Feature for Eldritch Ass Kicking
141123.description:
From Introduction:

Some wizards are really strange. Not only do they use their magicks for wicked pursuits and painful blasts of power, some use it to change their form and appearance to the outside world. While the usefulness of this ability might be debated, some spellflingers find it a perfect compliment to their potent array of arcane skill.

141124.name: The Stone of Agom: A Location for Eldritch Ass Kicking
141124.description:
From Introduction:

Like a single gnarled finger pointing to the immense heavens, the Stone of Agom rises up at the edge of a rocky cliff, floating out amidst the ruin of Anhelm. The Stone has an ancient history, believed to date back to the earliest settlers and natives of Anhelm. For whatever reason, the rock formation was seen as something holy and mysterious. Beginning then, some wise men climbed to the cliff and painstakingly began to carve etchings of magickal power into it.

141125.description:
[English]

141127.name: Week 1
141127.description:
From publisher blurb:

Although often times the best defense truly is a strong offense, what do you do when you are surrounded by a well-armed outlaw army with stolen military hardware, and dozens of Ragers let loose upon the hallways of the prison you had considered a safe haven? How do you oppose such forces with untrained women and children in your camp?

Trapped inside the Federal Correctional Facility hidden away near the Citizen Relocation Zone in Colorado, the characters must overcome seemingly insurmountable odds if they are to survive. Forced to flee and seek refuge, they are poorly equipped and ill prepared for the array of threats that confront them.
