boardgameimplementation.184984: ATS Historical Module: Backhand Blow '43 – The Third Battle of Kharkov 1943

141229.description:
KHARKOV, UKRAINE, 10 March 1943: The SS Forces under Obersturmbannführer Kurt 'Panzer' Meyer led his recon unit to drive through the Russians and form a blocking position in the southeast section of the surrounded city, around the cemetery. Meyer's men passed through the city center and held a blocking position despite being surrounded for two days, armed with the new MG 42 belt fed machine guns aided greatly in their defense, until contact was reestablished by a sister battalion commanded by Major Peiper. Lt. General Rybalko's forces in the city were composed of a Tank Brigade and NKVD security troops of his Third Tank Army. General Rybalko ordered his units to block the German units from moving through the city, establishing defense lines along the small river meandering through Kharkov. The local militias were called up to aid in the defense of the city and many were thrown piece meal against the SS units armed with new "wonder" weapons. Those new weapons included the MG 42, whose rate of fire almost doubled over the previous MG 34, from 600-800 rpm to 1100 to 1200 rpm. The German forces would begin to have a new type of problem, an inability to maintain a high enough level of supply of ammunition to take advantage of the high rate of fire of the MG42. Many soldiers interviewed after the battle were quoted to say that the rate of fire was so high it was impossible to discern acoustically the individual shells firing. Many cited that the machine guns sounded like the tearing of canvas.

On 12 March, the LSSAH made progress into the center of the city of Kharkov, breaking through hardened enemy defenses in the northern suburbs. What followed was a house-to-house bloodbath as the Germans pressed ever closer to city center. By the end of the day, the division had reached a position just two blocks north of Dzerzhinsky Square. The 2nd Panzergrenadier Regiment's 2nd Battalion was able to surround the square, after taking heavy casualties from Soviet snipers and other defenders, by evening. When taken, the square was renamed Platz der Leibstandarte. That night, 2nd Panzergrenadier Regiment's 3rd Battalion, under the command of Joachim Peiper, linked up with the 2nd Battalion in Dzerzhinsky Square and attacked southwards, crossing the Kharkov River and creating a bridgehead, opening the road to Moscow Avenue. Meanwhile, the division's left wing reached the junction of the Volchansk and Chuhuiv exit roads and went on the defensive, fighting off a number of enemy counter-attacks.

In the aftermath of the debacle at Stalingrad it almost defies belief that German soldiers, in this some of the last elite units available on the Eastern Front ... would plunge into the heart of a massive urban center and initiate house-to-house combat. But that's exactly what took place in Kharkov during the winter of 1943 and the results were a victory ... of sorts. The decline of German fortunes in the East were halted and the desire of Hitler to launch another offensive, to eliminate the Kursk Salient, was whetted. The battle also pointed some historians toward an answer to the 'what if' ... as in what if Hitler had assigned Waffen SS units to attack Stalingrad.

KHARKOV: BATTLE FOR THE SQUARE places you in the heart of an urban battlefield with nothing to fight with but elite units on both sides. The counter collection is impressive: ALL THE COMBAT COUNTERS NEEDED TO PLAY ALL OF THE SCENARIOS ... in ALL NEW presentations ... Germans AND Russians in Winter 1943 uniforms. And all AFV counters are 'winterized' ... aka 'whitewashed' ... to be more evocative than ever. What's more, the battlefield map is also done up in winter colors!

Players take the side of Either the German or Russian troops fighting in the City of Kharkov.
They fight historical battles/scenarios and try to win by fulfilling a set of victtory conditions
141229.name: ATS TT: Kharkov – Battle for the Square

141230.description:
MAMAEV KURGAN, STALINGRAD, RUSSIA, 27 September 1942: Acknowledging the damage done to his army in assaulting the southern and central sections of the city, General von Paulus had systematically reconfigured his forces for a fresh assault. Two shock groups were formed, with one consisting primarily of the 100th Jäger Division, whose task was to clear and control Mamaev Kurgan, followed by an advance into the Tennis Racket and the Bannyi Ravine and finally to occupy the Krasnyi Oktiabr workers' settlements. Paulus' counterpart, General Chuikov was well aware of these preparations and had planned appropriate spoiling attacks, though he was unaware of the fresh German reinforcements. His attack was disrupted before it could even begin, with waves of Stukas strafing his advancing forces. His strongpoint on the crest of the burial mound was destroyed. Bombs and artillery cut down the attackers, decimating their ranks and allowing the following German advance to gain ground. The jägers advanced two regiments abreast and captured the western slopes, but initially failed to take the southern slopes. The 227th Jäger Regiment's vigorous assaults, supported by intense artillery, destroyed the Russian ability to hold on. The Germans would secure the summit that evening (though some bypassed remnants would harass the Germans on the southern and western slopes for the next few days). By day's end, the 95th Division retained a foothold on the northern and eastern slopes of the burial mound, but was down to only 400 effective fighting men.

The Battle of Stalingrad has received no shortage of treatment in the wargame realm. No tactical-level game has ever treated the titanic and unique battle for Stalingrad's Mamayev Hill, aka Mamayev Kurgan ... until NOW. From the first thrusts of Hitler's Wehrmacht on 13 September to the last days of 1942 the hill changed hands time and again. By 27 September the Germans had again captured half of Mamayev Kurgan. The Soviets held their own positions on the slopes of the hill, as the 284th Rifle Division desperately defended key strongholds. The defenders held out until 26 January 1943, when the Soviet winter offensive known as Operation Uranus, relieved them, in the process trapping and destroying the German VI Armee in the tomb of Stalingrad.

When the battle ended, the blood-soaked hill known as Mamayev Kurgan was plowed up and under ... and mixed with blood and fragments of shrapnel (between 500 and 1,250 steel splinters were later counted per square meter). The earth on the hill had remained black in the winter, as the snow kept melting in the many fires and explosions. During the spring of 1943 the soil of Mamayev Kurgan remained black. No grass would sprout in its scorched and blood-soaked soil.

It's time to come out of the factories ... at least until CH's ATS Krasny Oktyabr hits the streets ... and have a unique Stalingrad-themed experience as you fight to hold, capture, or re-capture Mamayev Kurgan. Interested in accurate, color Molotov Projector counters? Check. Panzers in Eastern Front summer 1942 colors? Check. And a battlefield like none you and your cardboard soldiers have ever contested? Check and mate. It's time to get your Schmeisser strapped on, hitch a ride on the pack of a Panzerkampfwagen IIIj ... and get to where your Feldwebel tells you to get. Raus!
141230.name: ATS TT: Hill of Blood – Mamayev Kurgan

141232.name: So What's The Riddle Like, Anyway?
141232.description:
Publisher Blurb

Your PCs are deep in the dungeon and have just encountered a terrifying monster which they have no chance of defeating. Luckily, the monster is bored and challenges the party to a riddling contest instead of simply just killing them. Alternatively, the party have encountered a sentient statue that will not let them past until they have answered three riddles correctly. At this point, a GM may panic and just hand wave the ensuing riddles or allow the PCs to answer them correctly by making skill checks.

So What’s The Riddle Like, Anyway? banishes this problem by providing scores of ready-to-use riddles ready to insert into almost any GM’s campaign. Now a GM (or aspiring bard) has loads of riddles in his arsenal ready to strike fear into the hearts of those hearing them!

141233.name: So What's The Riddle Like, Anyway? II
141233.description:
Publisher Blurb

Your PCs are deep in the dungeon and have just encountered a terrifying monster which they have no chance of defeating. Luckily, the monster is bored and challenges the party to a riddling contest instead of simply just killing them. Alternatively, the party have encountered a sentient statue that will not let them past until they have answered three riddles correctly. At this point, a GM may panic and just hand wave the ensuing riddles or allow the PCs to answer them correctly by making skill checks.

So What’s The Riddle Like, Anyway? II picks up where So What’s The Riddle Like, Anyway? left off and presents scores more riddles ready to insert into almost any GM’s campaign. Now a GM (or aspiring bard) has loads of riddles in his arsenal ready to strike fear into the hearts of those hearing them!

141234.name: Clacto Dice
141234.description:
Game based on the use of magnetic marbles (clickets). The object is to place all the clickets on the game board (in the shape of a ruther), without moving them as a result of magnetic attraction.To determine to vacant place on the board where the clicket is to be put the players throw dice. Obviously the number of eyes on the dice determine the place to put the clicket.
The player who succeeds in placing his last clicket without disturbing the other marbles on the board wins the game.

141235.description: A pack containing 8 unpainted miniatures for Dungeon Twister Paladins and Dragons. Choice of four colors: blue, white, green and pink.
141235.name: Dungeon Twister Paladins and Dragons Miniatures

141236.description: A pack containing 8 unpainted miniatures for Dungeon Twister Fire & Water. Choice of four colors: blue, white, green and pink.
141236.name: Dungeon Twister Fire & Water Miniatures

141237.description: A pack containing 8 unpainted miniatures for Dungeon Twister Forces of Darkness. Choice of four colors: blue, white, green and pink.
141237.name: Dungeon Twister Forces of Darkness Miniatures

141238.description: A pack containing 4 unpainted zombies for Dungeon Twister Forces of Darkness. Choice of four colors: blue, white, green and pink.
141238.name: Dungeon Twister Zombies Set

141239.description: A pack containing 8 unpainted miniatures for Dungeon Twister Mercenaires. Choice of four colors: blue, white, green and pink.
141239.name: Dungeon Twister Mercenaires Miniatures

141240.name: Carthica's Pride Adventure Arc
141240.description:
From publisher blurb:

What happens when a pair of lackluster thieves with a fondness for intoxicants, courtesans, and easy coin leaves one of Tarina’s betters in the gutter? A game of vengeance and intrigue happens, that’s what!

Carthica’s Pride is a mini-adventure set in the port city of Tarina that invites the player characters to serve a very spoiled noble: a noble with a missing item of value that is not accustomed to being told “no.” Assigned to the job by the famous handler Natasha Corvina, the player characters, new to both adventuring and Tarina’s seedier side, must flatter, fight, and con their way through a series of challenges in search of a The Urgent Messenger – a mysterious rogue believed to be traveling with the two thieves. With their reputation and fortune on the line, the party races to find the two missing rogues before outside forces – agents of The Black Hand – close in for the kill.

141241.name: Secrets of the Tainted Adventure Arc
141241.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tarina is in turmoil over the brazen robbery of a powerful magic device from The Brotherhood of Magus. The Brotherhood is outraged by the theft, and is pressuring city officials to quickly apprehend the thieves and recover the item. Tracking down the culprits before the device can be smuggled out of the city will require brave heroes to travel the underground passages and catacombs of the city to infiltrate the lair of the factions called The Tainted.

SECRETS OF THE TAINTED is a city and underground adventure for 1st-level characters, and is compatible with the Pathfinder Role Playing Game. It includes details on The Tainted factions that rule the dark underbelly of the city, and the thriving Ratfolk community of Baubletown. Do your heroes have the courage and skill to catch the culprits before they escape?

This adventure can also be played as a prelude to THE TEMPLE OF THE SHINING PATH, an adventure for 3rd-level characters, available soon from BlackStar Studios.

141242.name: The Gates of Tarina
141242.description:
From publisher blurb:

A rider dies mysteriously just outside the city gates carrying a dangerous package with only a symbol to give any kind of clue as to the package’s origin or destination. Very quickly the players become embroiled in an underground world of intrigue and deceit and must use their wits to survive.

THE GATES OF TARINA is a full-length adventure set in the port city of Tarina that invites the player characters to investigate a mystery of missing contraband magical swords. Players can choose to ally themselves with one of three different factions in the city as they follow a trail of blood, betrayal, and an ancient secret.

141243.name: Shadowlands Conversion Guide

rpghonor.19123: 2012 ENnies for Best Free Product - Nominee

141243.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter an enormous, ancient fantasy gaming world as rigorously realistic as ours, replete with dark, gritty, manipulative personalities and cultures – a place where racial and religious tensions are as real as any! In the Shadowlands, players will interface with ancient technologies, navigate byzantine layers of intrigue and survive just long enough to maybe achieve the power of the Old Gods themselves!

Explore the world of Saemyyr! Dare the dangerous streets of the decadent and imperialistic Tar Sequin Empire or delve into the cold north, where the fierce and independent northmen of Valgaard hold the most brutal courts! Enter the mystical forest of Sylvænyr, where the Dætholayn still stand guard against all outsiders. Or journey to the wild dangerous steppes of Torán, whose brave riders value nothing as much as a loyal mount and strong sword and the courage to face the encroaching Shadowlands! Or, brave the jungles outside Tarina, where ancient evils still stir!

A step-by-step outline aimed at helping players build characters that are suitable for any Shadowlands campaign setting adventure, including how each class and race from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game are treated in the Shadowlands!

141244.name: Guide to the Camarilla & Sabbat (Limited Edition)
141244.description:
User Summary:

This limited edition product consists of copies of Guide to the Camarilla and Guide to the Sabbat, bound in black faux-leather, and marked in silver. On the cover of each book is the symbol for the relevant organisation (an ankh for the Camarilla and an inverted ankh for the Sabbat). The books are collected in a hardback slipcase, open along one edge, upon which the original (standard edition) book covers are illustrated.

141245.name: Handle With Care
141245.description:
This is a Larp, and a story game.

There is a city which is like most others: in it are individual people who are trying to puzzle out their problems and who decide to stay up all night to wander the city in search of meaning, and there are also giant monsters who sneak unnoticed through the city, peering in at the lives of the humans and
watching them consider their problems. And of course there's the municipal light truck, with its big searchlight which drives around attempting to locate these supposed giant monsters.

141246.name: InGendarme
141246.description: This game is about a world in the balance. At this point, the scales may tip towards peace or war, towards tyranny or cooperation or towards unity or patriotism. No one can imagine what the world will be like when this is over, but it will not be the same, that is for certain. Your character will be a member of the elite Engine-equipped InGendarme. You have been given carte blanche to take any action to secure peace around the world. What will you do and how far will you go?

141247.name: Tea Society of a Witch

videogameversion.206503: Japanese Dreamcast (First Press Limited Edition) edition

141247.description:
Long, long ago, there was a world in which mages and humans existed in harmony. Deep contrasts in their two cultures, however, caused differences that could not be overcome between the two races. The humans feared the great power of the mages, and hunted them, trying to erase their kind from the earth.

Despairing, the mages sought refuge, and God, feeling pity for their plight, created a world of magic for them, which they could go to in exile. In this way the mages faded from the Earth, and all contact between the two peoples ceased. Each continued on their own paths, the humans that of civilization, and mages that of magic.

A few hundred years have passed since that time... The mages are hopeful that, once again, their races can live in harmony. In the hope of finding a way to bridge their differences, the mages send out their young acolytes for training in the world of the humans. If the younger generations of the two peoples can find a way of connecting, perhaps the acolytes could gain important knowledge, and bring it home with them.

This year three young wizards will cross over into the world of humans... Two of them are elite, and one a total drop out. Can they reunite the two peoples?

Source: The Publisher Website.

141248.name: Fun Bowl Football
141248.description:
This game features a picture of Hall Of Fame Coach Paul "Bear" Bryant. The game is a dice game where dice are used to determine the outcome of each play. Cards represent various plays for the defense to guess what the offense will choose. If the defense gets the correct play, any yardage gained is cut in half.

The box cover states "100 made in USA"

2378.name: Copag - Cia. Paulista de Artes Gráficas

boardgamehonor.25026: 2013 Ludo Award Best Board Game Popular Winner

141249.description:
Battle Scenes is a Collectible Card Game produced by Copag - Companhia Paulista de Artes Gráficas and based upon the Marvel universe.
The players must have a 60 card deck (up to 3 copies of each card) with at least 15 characters, and 30 or more health points in his deck.
Each player draws 10 cards and can discard cards to his resource pile.
The objective of the game is to Knock-Out enemy characters for a total amount of 15 points of health.

The playing areas are:

Resources Area (Where the cards sent/discarded to resources go)
Scene Area (Where the active characters, support and scenarios are played, until they're discarded or knocked-out)
Prize Area (Where the knocked-out characters stay, counting points to the oposing player)




Here's the turn order:

COUNTDOWN PHASE
If the turn player doesn't have a character on the scene, he needs to discard the top card of his deck to the resource pile plus an additional card for each charater card your opponent has on the scene, plus an additional one for each character your opponent defeated (that is on his Prize Area).

PREPARATION PHASE
In this phase you can:

discard one card from your hand to the resource pile (may only do this once a turn)
charge a character that wasn't already charged this turn (may only do this once a turn)
discard a card from your hand to charge a character that wasn't already charged this turn
play a character or support card
play a scenario. There can be only one card of this type at the table at a time, and this action can only be done once per turn
knock-out your own character to buy a card
discard a character you opponent has in play to draw a card




ADJUSTMENT PHASE
In this phase, you must discard down to 7 cards in hand and remove any excess cards on your characters.

COMBAT PHASE
In this phase, the players can pay charges on their characters to use the actions they have or to use the actions they are carrying.


Antecipation Stage


First of all, the opposing player has the chance to perform his Antecipation Actions, as said in his characters cards.


Attack Stage


Then the current player uses his actions by paying charges from his characters. Each character can only perform one action.

ENDING THE GAME
When a character is defeated, the cards attached to it are discarded to the resource area. Only the character goes to the prize area.
If, at any point in the game, a player has 15 points, he is the winner.

AWARDS


2013 Ludo Award Winner (Editor's Choice and Popular)
141249.name: Battle Scenes

141250.description:
Pirate's Treasure (Pirackie Skarby) is a fast and simple game for 2-5 players.
In the middle of the table, there is 3x3 Treasure Island.

In each round, one player, places 5 Map Tiles, one by one. After last tile has been placed, players try to find a treasure on the island. They do that, by imagining road, from the middle of the island.

After 4 rounds, player with the most treasure is the winner.
141250.name: Pirackie Skarby

boardgamefamily.24847: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

141251.name: Montenotte
141251.description:
The first of the SB (Small Battles) series is also the first dedicated to the Napoleonic age. The game covers both the battle days with optional rules for the second one, making it possible for the Austrian player to avoid the moronic placement, the letargic leadership and pathetic planning of Argenteau that condamned the Austrian forces to a complete defeat.

Based on activation chits and operative orders, the game system features the different effects of formations on movement, fire and melee, forcing players to change their plans and to adapt their unit line of battle to respond to the enemy. Counters represent single batallions, batteries or skirmisher units.

141252.name: Determinance
141252.description:
Determinance is a multi-player action game which allows you to create your own fighting style. Take on a single opponent in Duel Arena, or engage in a frenetic Free For All battle against up to eight other players online or on a LAN. Offline play against AI opponents is also available.

Source: The Game Website.

141253.name: GrimmLITE
141253.description:
From publisher blurb:

A patched together Humpty Dumpty is the dreaded Rotten King of the Big and Awful Forest and only his madness prevents him from conquering the Checkered Kingdom. Cinderella grew up to become a dictatorial, sadistic queen and Little Red Riding Hood is a cursed teenage vampire who travels the lands under a blood soaked cloak suggestively luring in her next victim. Hansel and Gretel are now the cannibalistic servants of the house made of sweets, since the witch is no more. These are not your grandma's fairytales… but your great-grandmother is familiar with The Brothers Grimm.

The descriptions above are mere examples of what the Grimm Lands may hold instore for you. They are based on familiar fairy tales, folk lore, myth, nursery ryhmes, or anything else that may have captivated you as a child. As we grow older we see how violent and awful the events in these stories are. We recognize the immoral acts and we notice the triviality of the human experience. The characters are sometimes forced to deal with awful entities to preserve their own lives. Make sure the players discuss and decide what sort of Grimm experience they would like before delving in. For some, it may be an opportunity to consider the implications of these deeper topics. For others, it may simply be a fun chance to pretend to be the bully they hated, the popular kid they envied, or to relive being the nerd or dreamer. Grimm could stretch into an extended campaign wherein the kids take over the Grimm Lands. Alternatively, the game could be short-lived where the characters are snuffed out one by one. Somewhere in between a Grimm campaign may take characters from 1st to 6th level culminating in a “skin of their teeth” escape to the real world. Regardless of your style; this game is all about fantastic imagination.

Take on the persona of a child who has slipped from reality into a nightmare of grotesque fantasy. The core system is MicroLITE d20 which is a simple yet robust version of D&D d20. While significant portions of the game have been adapted, you will find that most of it translates simply and concepts are easy to grasp. This streamlined core system makes the mechanics easier so that players are more free to focus on the story and characters; putting the Role Playing back in Role Playing Games!

141254.description:
Promo given out for Easter 2013 - note the egg shaped promo card icon in the right-bottom corner - that can be used with all Ascension base sets and expansions that have come out as of April 2013.

Text on card:
Big Bad Bunny - 8 power
Monster
Fate: Place a card from the center deck facedown under this and each other card in the center row. When a player acquires or defeats a card on top of a facedown card, they acquire or defeat the facedown card without paying its cost.
Reward: Gain 5 Honour Crystals. Acquire or defeat all facedown cards in the center row.
141254.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Big Bad Bunny Promo

141255.name: Loversopoly
141255.description:
Lover'sopoly was created for the sole intended purpose of creating a game intended for married couples that most adult board games on the market today do not offer. Most adult board games today are very shallow and have no depth to them. married couples have often purchased "sex games" that come and go and offer no substance. Lover'sopoly touches on every level of marriage relationship from intimacy, to sex, to romance and even humor.

The players are by rolling the dice and advancing to the next space. Spaces consist of "action spaces" as well as "Pandora's Box" and "Naughty or Nice". When landing on an action space the individual has the right to purchase the space and build on the space "time chips". By purchasing more time chips they receive more time with the action when their spouse lands on it. "Padora's Box" and "Naughty or Nice" are not properties open to ownership but rather actions or questions that are fueled throughout the game and keep the game interesting and moving along. The goal is to own as many of the desired action properties but watch out because your partner may earn the right to purchase an action property right from under your nose.

The action properties are the most creative portion of the game. Ladies, how would you like to receive a nice 3 minute kneck massage every time your partner lands on your space?
Or perhaps you wouldn’t mind your partner drawing a seductive pose of you in your birthday suite? Men, how would you like your spouse enjoying a nice dessert off of your mid-section? Or perhaps having your wife describe your most attractive features?

This game has everything for both male and female and is the perfect way to spark up a relationship. Loversopoly makes the best Valentine’s Day gift as well.

141256.description:
Ascension Promo given out at April 2013 Game Days that can be used with any of the Ascension products that have been released sofar.

Text on card:
Shuffletron 2K13 - 2 Runes
Mechana Construct
Once per turn, when you play a Mechana Construct (including this one), you may shuffle your discard pile into your deck.
Whenever you would shuffle your deck, you may have an opponent shuffle your deck instead.
Reward: 2 Honor Crystals
141256.name: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer – Shuffletron 2K13 Promo

141257.name: 'hood (Revised)
141257.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a hack for Apocalypse World by Vincent Baker, so first things first: you will need a copy of that game in order to make any sense out of what follows.

This specific hack is called 'hood and it's all about holding on: all the player-characters are small fish in a big pond, chancers and petty criminals looking for ways to make ends meet without becoming of interest to the authorities, who might send them to prison, or the real villains, who might send them to the graveyard. The PCs are part of a network, or better still, a network of networks: families, friends, colleagues at their day job, suppliers, customers, rivals and more. Surviving is all about avoiding upsetting the people in your networks; prospering is all about taking advantage of them.

User note: Includes 14 playbooks (listed below) as well as MC information.

The Bastion
The Blur
The Fallen
The Feelgood
The Go-Between
The Heavy
The Ice
The Lever
The Merchant
The Mover
The Pimp
The Schemer
The Shark
The Thief

141258.name: Escape the Blob
141258.description:
You can run but you can't hide!

The object of the game is to move Swamp Hoppers around the board, trying to avoid having them gobbled up by Zob the Blob. Players on a turn will either move their Swamp Hoppers or Zob the Blob according to the roll of the character die. The last player to have one or more Swamp Hoppers on the board at the end of the game is the winner.

It's a roll and move game there you try to catch the other players Swamp Hoppers with a large plastic monster who can swallow the Swamp Hoppers with a gentle pull when it land on the same space.

141259.name: Red Dragon Inn: Guide to Inns and Taverns
141259.description:
kickstarter blurb

The Red Dragon Inn: Guide to Inns and Taverns is a 168-page Pathfinder compatible sourcebook - the ultimate toolbox on inns and taverns. It will include new rules for resolving gambling and drinking and be filled to the brim with NPCs, maps, and more.

The Guide will have all the details you need to add The Red Dragon Inn to your game:

All the drinks from the card game and even some new ones! Over 20 drinks with their effects, serving sizes, prices and other details are included.
The Traditions common to The Red Dragon Inn – like Drinking Contests and Gambler’s Grog – and the answer to the question: “Who, in their right mind, orders Dirty Dishwater?”
The story of founding of The Red Dragon Inn and Warthorn Redbeard, the dwarf who started it all!

141260.name: Phantom of Inferno
141260.description:
Phantom of Inferno details the life of a 15-year-old Japanese boy who is kidnapped after witnessing the killing of a reporter. The memories of his past life are erased, and he is given the choice to join 'Inferno' or die. After joining the organization he is given the name 'Zwei' and will study under 'Ein'. Ein is also known as 'Phantom', the title given to the organization's top assassin.

Inferno is said to be the 'United Nations of crime syndicates'. As Zwei makes his way through training and various missions, deceit and betrayal occur even within Inferno and slowly put Zwei in increasing danger. Along the way, Zwei meets a girl by the name of Cal Devens and, though he tries to protect her, she too is drawn into Inferno to become the assassin, 'Drei'.

The game is divided into three chapters. The first chapter deals with Zwei being turned into a killer and has two main "routes" to follow, the Ein route and the Claudia route. No matter which route is chosen, the chapter ends with Scythe escaping and Ein presumably dead, unless one opts to escape back to Japan. The second chapter starts off one year after the events in the first chapter, and deals with Claudia's plan to bring the Godoh group into the organization, Scythe's revenge, and the introduction of a new character, Cal Devens. It contains the Cal route and the final Claudia route.

In 2010, Nitroplus announced the game will be remade for the Xbox 360 featuring the same scenario but based on the designs created for the anime series from Bee Train. Character designs from artists Minkao Shiba, Yoko Kikuchi, Tomoaki Kado, Yoshimitsu Yamashita and Yoshiaki Tsubata were introduced into the 360 version. In addition the cast of the anime series also reprised their roles for the new version.

Source: Wikipedia, "Phantom of Inferno", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141261.name: Serpent's Tooth
141261.description:
From the publisher:

Serpent's Tooth is a tabletop game of collaborative storytelling. In it, we choose a King, create a Kingdom to rule, then play out a series of scenes to discover what happens.

At the start of the game the King possesses three Regalia: a crown, castle, and sword, that give them authority over the characters, places, and threats in the kingdom. Like a Game Master in a traditional role-playing game, the king wields vast power over their Kingdom.

The rest of us play members of the Kings Court. We might begin as subservient nobles, losers, jocks, or lowly dish-dogs at a fast food restaurant, but through play, when we seize the King's Regalia, we seize the Narrative Authority that goes with it. Serpent's Tooth is fun, fast, and a little profound. It is both a love letter to the golden age of RPGs, an an exploration of what it means to rule.

141262.name: Guacamelee!

videogamehonor.33145: 2013 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Nominee

141262.description:
Guacamelee! builds upon the classic open-world metroidvania style of games, by adding a strong melee combat component, a new dimension switching mechanic, and cooperative same-screen multiplayer for the entire story. The game also blurs the boundaries between combat and platforming by making many of the moves useful and necessary for both of these.

Guacamelee! features a down on his luck Mexican named Juan Aguacate, who sets out to save the world when El Presidente’s Daughter is kidnapped by an Evil Charro Skeleton named Carlos Calaca. The story takes place in and around a small village in Mexico, and has the player swapping between dimensions known as “The Living World” and “The Dead World” on his quest to rescue the girl he loves.

Source: Wikipedia, "Guacamelee", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141263.name: Seal Team 12
141263.description:
When evil lurks on the horizon, you need the best. You need the strongest. You need SEAL Team 12!

As a member of SEAL Team 12, you must battle through massive enemy waves and break the enemies spine with the force of truth, justice and explosions!

Play single player or together with a friend in this action packed Top Down Shooter where you battle Infantry, Tanks, Dogs, Ninjas, and actual Seals! Defeat the forces of evil with heavy weapons such as the trusty rocket launcher, the faithful Uzi, machine guns, and other tools of destruction.

Game Features:
Single Player or Co-op play
Fast paced arcade twin-stick shooter
Piles of weapons to choose from
Leader boards & High score tracking
Custom Soundtrack
Epic Storyline
Evil Enemies and Bosses

Similar to:
Ikari Warriors
Commando I & 2
Heavy Barrel
Contra

Source: The Developer Website.

141264.name: Sargon
141264.description:
Sargon is a line of chess-playing software for personal computers. The original Sargon was written by Dan and Kathleen 'Kathe' Spracklen on a Z80-based computer called Wavemate Jupiter III.

Sargon was introduced at the 1978 West Coast Computer Faire, where it won the first computer chess tournament held strictly for microcomputers. This success encouraged the authors to sell the program directly to customers. Through an ad in Byte Magazine they sold (for $15) photocopied listings of the assembly language program that would work on most any Z80-based microcomputer. Availability of the source code allowed porting to other machines.

A Navy Petty Officer, Paul Lohnes, ported Sargon to the TRS-80, altering both graphics, input, and housekeeping routines leaving the Spracklen's chess-playing algorithm intact. The TRS-80 version became an instant success with the help of Hayden Book's newly established software division: Hayden Software.

Hayden also released Sargon for the Apple II. A complete rewrite was necessary for the Apple II port, and this was done by Kathleen's brother Gary Shannon.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sargon (chess)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141265.name: Twisted Letters
141265.description:
Word games are fun especially if you can spell. Twisted Letters is a word game where you spell words off of a 5x5 grid of letters. Words are spelled by connecting letters one after another. Scores are calculated at the end of each round which lasts 2 minutes. Points are assigned based on the length of the word. Incorrectly spelled words do not accumulate points.

Features:
fast paced spelling fun
easy to pick up and start playing
statistics at the end of each round
global leader boards via Game Center

Source: The Developer Website.

141266.name: Ransack
141266.description:
Ransack is a cut-throat board game for two players. Ransack is about two thieves, The Wolf and The Scorpion, who have challenged each other to a thieves' duel.

Both players must race to be the first to loot 11 coins from the dungeon. This is easier said than done, though, since your fate rests on the fickle nature of coin tosses.

Players take turns navigating through a dungeon that is built using tiles drawn from a central pile. Combat, events and deciding whose turn it is are all handled using coin flips.

Optional rule variants include a gambling / drinking versions. Due to the inclusion of these rules in the rule book the minimum age is set at 18.

141267.name: Block Man II
141267.description:
The Block Man II adventures continue as he tries to prove his worth to Princess Pentagwin and gain her hand by collecting all the jewels scattered about the countryside. Great ingenuity is required to solve these mind-bending puzzles using teleports, elevators, boats, blocks and much more. Block Man II has great sound blaster support, solutions and smooth scrolling VGA graphics!

Source: The Developer Website.

141268.name: Bolo Adventures
141268.description:
Bolo Adventures is a mind-boggling strategy game where the objective is to get Mr. Bolo out of 40 rooms of puzzles. Each room is filled with obstacles such as monsters, lasers, electric grills and more! Bolo Adventures is not a contest of how fast you can acquire carpal tunnel syndrome by hammering on the keyboard, it is a pure test of your resourcefulness.

Source: The Developer Website.

141269.name: Bolo Adventures III
141269.description:
The puzzles in Bolo Adventures III are the most difficult yet! Once again Mr. Bolo uses balls, water, ramps and more... to figure out how to exit each room. Packed with features and all the solutions, this one's a real brain twister! Are you up to the challenge?

Source: The Developer Website.

141270.name: FaceTrex
141270.description:
FaceTrex is a challenging and pure strategy logic game where the objective is to use your animated man to push faces located on a 12x8 grid board onto their negative image located elsewhere. All the solutions are provided for the 40 mind-bending puzzles. A real challenge!!!

Source: The Developer Website.

141271.name: Ladder Man III
141271.description:
Help Ladder Man collect all the light bulbs in each of the 30 puzzle rooms and then try to reach the elusive doorway. Use Ladder Man’s ladder to reach objects like TNT, boats, balloons and crates, while avoiding deadly lasers and dangerous water hazards. You must literally try to construct his escape. If you become stumped, check out the included solutions.

Source: The Developer Website.

141272.name: Temples
141272.description:
Publisher Blurb

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring your towns and cities alive with cool, interesting minor features of note?

Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different common urban fixture such as shops, stalls, thieves and so on and gives the harried GM the tools to bring such features to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great features to add to the temples in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Temples is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Temples presents:


One table (100 entries) presenting a temple’s unique appearances and characteristics.
One table (100 entries) presenting the features of a temple based on the domains of the deity worshipped within.
Three table (20 entries each) presenting sample sacrifices based dependant on the general ethos of the faith.
One table (20 entries) presenting sample events and festivals.
A group of nested tables designed to enable the GM to quickly generate the details of the temple’s staff.

141273.name: Make Space For Puma  The PRS Board Game
141273.description:
Game Intention:
More space, more sales, more margin. This logic is part of our Phase 4 growth strategy. Now we want to make it happen. To be The Better Retail Partner we need to grow deeper into the world of retail. PRS provides ways and solutions to make, maintain and increase PUMA branded retail space on retailer's floors.

As growth is serious business, we decided to wrap it up in a. Game for you to play with your PRS buddies.

Each player starts with $70,000 capital and you explore the game board that shows brand environments in various retail situations. Embedded in these environments are PRS opportunities. Make money by collecting your realized solutions' operating profit each round.

To win the game, you must a) pass the collect operating profit field with b) all space opportunities of your color realized, and c) the highest operating profit (cash minus IOU and interest) of all players. Once a player calls "game over" all other players collect one round of operating profit. Continue game, if operating profit of another player is higher than that of caller...

141274.name: Let's Go to Campmeeting
141274.description:
"Meetings, hikes, choir practice, fire duty, and a baptism. All the fun, excitement, and spiritual renewal of a true to life campmeeting."

Players draw destination cards and roll the dice to proceed to that location. Upon arriving at their destination, players read and follow the instructions and when finished draw a new destination card. Players earn souls for completing tasks and arriving at destinations.

Play continues until "The Last Day of Campmeeting" card is drawn.

The player who has collected the most souls, wins that game.

141275.description:
Whitetail Wilderness is a game about hunting white-tailed deer. Game play is scenario-driven, with a modular "board" of hex tiles created as per the scenario set up rules.

The specific game objective depends on the scenario, but generally requires the players to do one of the following within a specified number of game rounds:

- Shoot the biggest buck
- Shoot a specific buck
- Shoot the most deer or most total points in bucks

Players control Hunter characters as their game personas. Six pre-generated characters are included as well as blank cards for people to create their own. Each Hunter character is rated 1 to 5 on six different attributes. Event cards and player actions will test the skills of each Hunter character.

On their turn, players execute two actions from among nine different choices. The players are attempting to find a good hunting area while increasing their rating on the Deer Encounter Meter, which is a measure of progress toward finding where the deer are located. Eventually, players will execute Hunt actions in the hopes of seeing deer. Once a player determines that deer are present, the deer need to be identified and brought in close enough for a shot. As the deer move closer and the encounter continues, the alertness level of the deer will generally begin to increase as they sense danger nearby. If the players aren't careful, the deer may flee and ruin their chances for a shot.

Players have to manage their Energy levels, items, Hunter cards and save up for bonuses while staying aware of what the other players are doing and attempt to blunt their efforts where possible.
141275.name: Whitetail Wilderness

141276.name: Invasions Tuatha Dé Danann
141276.description:
In Invasions Tuatha Dé Danann, players will storm the ancient island of Ireland as the Tuatha Dé Danann, seeking to conquer and claim the land from the Fir Bolg inhabitants. The Tuatha Dé Danann are not the only invading faction, the inbound Milesians and Fomorians will also take part in what will be a legendary war!

Players shall gather resources, fortify hill-forts, reinforce Tuathian armies, and construct megalithic stones which are essential for a Tuatha Dé Danann victory.

The invading factions seek the land for themselves, so the Tuatha Dé Danann must seek each others help, if they wish to have any chance at fending off these invasions.

Survive the invaders and the mightiest of the Tuatha Dé Danann will become King. Fail, and the Tuatha Dé Danann are history!

On each turn, players will take part in each of the Gather, Build, Training, Movement, and Exploration Phases. These phases will allow the players to use their worker units to gather the resources they need to strengthen their control of the island. These resources will be necessary during other phases, where players will be able to construct hill-forts, prepare armies for battle, and build megalithic stones to solidify the strength of the Tuatha Dé Danann across the land.

141277.name: Wreckateer
141277.description:
Featuring Avatar FameStar! Wreckateer uses the Kinect to put you in control of a massive castle-wrecking Ballista. With the help of Wreck and Tinker, use 6 magic projectiles to travel the land and destroy 60 castles.

Game requires Kinect.

Source: The Game Website.

141278.name: Ameritrash
141278.description:
In the far distant future, the world is recovering from global devastation brought on by both nuclear and biological warfare. The area occupied by the former United States of America is one of the first land areas to experience a rebirth of civilization. Old technology is salvaged and relearned. Eight distinct regions emerge, each with its own ideals, but all predicated on peace. No one wants to repeat the mistakes of the past. Almost no one…

Over time, four Overlords emerge. Vying for wealth and power, each establishes his own ragtag army. Slowly, their minions spread throughout the eight habitable regions. Death and destruction follow in their wake as each faction battles the other for land, fuel, wealth, and power. Which will triumph over the others, bringing a final, lasting peace to the land? Only time and Thompson machine guns will tell.

The boardgame Ameritrash, like its namesake gaming genre, is an exciting, tension-filled game, rich in theme, filled with player conflict, and possessing a large amount of dice! Two to four players assume the role of an Overlord of a military faction intent on securing as much plunder and power as possible. During the span of five turns, players move their ramshackle units across the gameboard, attempting to capture objectives, pillage wealth, and weaken enemy factions.

Quick to learn and fun to play, Ameritrash is game of low to moderate complexity, and heavy firepower.

141279.name: Multiverse (Issue 5 - Spring 1985)
141279.description:
Front Cover:
The Australian Role Playing Gamers' Magazine

AD&D and Super Squadron module, Runequest Race, News, Strips

141280.name: Dream Day: Wedding Destinations
141280.description:
Love is in the Air! Dream Day Wedding Destinations delivers a romantic adventure filled with hidden treasures, excitement and the inevitable wedding crisis! For the Nintendo DS®.
Features

Plan a Wedding! Three different brides are counting on you to plan their perfect Dream Day Wedding.
Choose A Love Story! It's up to you to decide how the couples met, fell in love and got engaged.
Make it Perfect! Find each bride's necessary items at the florist, bridal shop, bakery and more to make her big day a dream.

Source: The Developer Website.

141281.name: DD Tournament Poker: No Limit Texas Hold'em
141281.description:
User Summary

Another Poker simulation. Single player only, but simulates a massive poker tournament.

141282.name: Droppix
141282.description:
Try and clear the board with this all new action-packed puzzler! Play through four exciting scenarios as you lift pieces and drop them back down again to match 3 or more colors. A unique twist on the color matching puzzle genre. Try and set off a cascading chain reaction to earn mega points. Are you fast enough to keep up?

Source: The Developer Website.

141283.name: Euchre
141283.description:
Play the classic trick-taking card game Euchre on your computer. Compete against the computer's AI players for a real challenge. This Euchre game is played with a deck of 32 cards. Four players play in pairs, one human player and 3 computer players. Enjoy a soothing soundtrack and smooth animated gameplay. Includes detailed in-game rules and help. Classic card game fun for all ages!

Features
Real Euchre rules
Play against the computer AI
Fast animated play
Detailed game rules included
Soothing soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

141284.name: Pyramide du Pharaon
141284.description:
The name of the game translate from French to "Pyramid of the Pharaoh". The intro of the game says that "the game has been discovered in archaeological research in Egypt and was designed by a Pharaoh during Ancient era where he invited guests to play a game during his parties where they had to build a pyramid with hieroglyphs carved on a tablet".

It is an Egyptian theme card game based on both luck and strategy that is designed for the family with rules very easy to undestand. The goal of the game is to be the first to build his pyramid. In order to do so, the players need collect cards that represent different resources such as workers, materials, tools, administration, royal family and of course a pharaoh. Some cards have negative effect. During his turn, a player can draw a card or play a "Mystery" card which allow him to steal a card from another player, exchange a card, build his pyramid, play an extra turn or protect parts of his pyramid already built.

141285.name: Rise of the Hutt Cartel
141285.description:
The Old Republic's first expansion pack, Rise of the Hutt Cartel is centered around the rising threat of the Hutt Cartel, which has arisen to challenge the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire for control of the galaxy. The battle with the Hutts is centered around the planet Makeb, which hides a "powerful secret". Much like the main game, the campaign on Makeb is fully voiced. The expansion raises the level cap to 55, with the leveling from 50 onwards centered around Makeb.

Released on April 14, 2013, those who preordered it prior to January 7, 2013 were allowed early access starting on April 9.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars: The Old Republic", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

141287.name: Tokyo Sourcebook
141287.description:
User summary:
Late in November 1996, Fujimi-shobo, a licensee of Shadowrun in Japan, released a Shadowrun sourcebook in Japan, which was titled "Tokyo Sourcebook".
This was the first supplement for Shadowrun published in Japan. Its cover said "Everything about Tokyo in 2054", "From the detailed descriptions of each districts, to the Japanese magic and critters."
It seemed to be the Japanese equivalent to London Sourcebook or Germany Sourcebook. This was the sourcebook of Tokyo and Japan Imperial State in 2050, written by Japanese people.

141288.name: Numino
141288.description:
Math-domino with numbers in one half of tile and operation in another half of tile.
Tiles may be placed only with different halfs touching each-other and the number-half must be answer of the operation of the other half.

Who runs out of his tiles first is the winner.

141289.name: Seasons of the Sun
141289.description:
The game revolves around the changing patterns of sunspots during their approximately 11-year cycles. Each player has 11 wooden disks in one color. The circular board is divided into eleven sectors grouped into two areas: a 6-sector zone where players try to have as much sunspots as possible, and a 5-sector area, where the aim is to place as few sunspots as possible. Sunspots are represented by pips on dice faces. Each sector shows a rating number (5,8,9,10,13 or 15 in the 'max' sectors, and 9,10, 11, 13 or 17 in the 'min' sectors).

There are three standard dice to roll and ca. 60 small dice used to represent sunspots. The 11 sectors are divided into two circular annuli (outer and inner ring), one for each player.
Players alternate rolling three dice (1-3 dice can be rolled one additional time, if the player so wishes). The final three rolled values are added to produce a number of 'sunspots' that are then placed on any free sector in the player's ring. If the opponent has the same number of sunspots in the inner or outer adjacent ring, the sunspots from both sectors are removed. If both players have different number of sunspots in the two fields on a given sector, the player with the higher (in a 'max' sector) or lower (in a 'min' sector) number wins the sector, which changes the turn order so that it's now this player's turn again. At the end of the game, players add the rating values of the sectors they have won. The player with the highest rating is the winner.

141290.name: Stick-to-It!
141290.description:
Players toss the self-stick ball on the special wall-board to land on a “letter fish” or a “picture fish,” and then must answer the question about that letter or picture depending on the game.
If the answer is correct player scores a point.

f.e.:
Toss and say the letter. “This is the letter
Toss and say a word that begins that word
Toss and say the picture word and identify its beginning sound.
etc.

Player with the most correct answers is the winner.

141291.description:
The Mystique Deck is a special deck of 60 cards, with each card depicting three different features (instead of two, like a regular poker deck):


Colour: Yellow, red, and blue — the 3 primary colours of pigment. There are 20 cards of each colour.
Suit: Suns, Moons, Arms, and Crowns. Suns and moons are the ‘heaven’ cards. Arms and Crowns are the ‘earth’ cards. There are 15 cards of each suit.
Number: from 1 to 5. Fives are depicted with an open palm, with the corresponding coloured suit in its palm. There are 12 cards of each number.


Moreover, each card has a unique number at the top, from 1 to 60. This is the ‘card number’.

Some examples of cards are:

Three of red crowns,
One of blue suns (also called ace of blue suns),
Five of yellow arms (also called palm of yellow arms)




There are two different Mystique decks: Mystique Gold and Mystique Silver. Both have the same card distribution; only the backs are different.

The Mystique Deck includes a default game also called Mystique, but the deck has been designed to be used in different future games. You will be able to download new rules from the nestorgames site as they are uploaded.
141291.name: The Mystique Deck

141292.name: Insurgence
141292.description:
Insurgence is an assymetric PnP two-player game that pits brave rebels against an evil empire in a futuristic capital. Or maybe it's a benevolent empire against cruel terrorists - the victor will decide.

The game is played on a 3x3 grid of tiles that make up the districts of the capital. Both players use action cards to move pawns around the districts, but they each have very different goals.

The rebels use hidden rebel cells and their rebel leader to fulfil plots by doing sabotage, making assasinations, and spreading propaganda throughout the districts. If the rebel player fulfils two out of three plots, he/she wins the game. But the rebels also work on causing uprising in the districts. This allows riots to spread from the slums towards the imperial palace. If that happens, the rebels also win.

The empire player, meanwhile, try to either uncover the plots by sorrounding cells with armies and revealing them, or to capture the rebel leader by clever use of both armies and the secret police. If the empire player uncovers all three plots or captures the leader, he/she wins.

In order to win you have to plan carefully while still being able to adapt to an unlucky draw of action cards. But most of all you'll have to both outwit and outbluff your opponent.

141293.description:
Mystique, the default game for The Mystique Deck, is a climbing game for 2 to 6 individual players that can be also played in pairs (4 or 6 players).

In Mystique, the players are spellcasters in combat who start each skirmish with a hand of spell cards; each card includes a number (1-5), a color (red, blue or yellow), and a suit (Suns, Moons, Arms, or Crowns). The first spellcaster opens a round by "casting a spell" – that is, she chooses up to five cards from her hand that have something in common (either the same number, the same suit, or the same color), then announces the number of cards she's chosen and what they have in common as she places them face up on the table; e.g., "three crowns" or "four yellow". The following player must either:


Cast an equal or stronger spell of the same type as the previous player (i.e., the same number of cards — or more — with the same common feature), thereby passing the turn to the next player, or



Take all cards that have been played during this round and place them face down in a pile next to herself. These are her "burns". This ends the round. She becomes the new "spellcaster" and opens a new round.


When a player must open a new round but has no cards in hand, the skirmish ends and the player with the fewest burns wins. Ties are possible. The game can be played to the best of three or five skirmishes. Mystique includes two advanced rules, covering "aces scoring" and "spell deflection".
141293.name: Mystique

141295.name: Global Chemistry
141295.description:
In this game players create chemical companies in order to devellop as much products as possible. During the game, the players are confronted with economical, chemical and technical questions.
Products can be created within one of the four categories: specialties, energy, consumer products of pharmaceuticals. Through research, design, and pilot phase a final product is created and victory points are gained.
But the competition can be hard and they can make it difficult for the player to make a return on his investment for the products he's creating. The winner is the player who dominates the world's economy by creating the most products and gaining the most victory points.

This game was created as an educational game by Identity Games International bv in collaboration with students from the Technical University of Delft (T.U.Delft) in The Netherlands and with sponsorship from multiple chemical companies. On release, a free copy was sent to almost 1000 schools in The Netherlands and Belgium.

Game Play :

Players throw the dice to move around the board. There are different types of spaces they can land on :
- Products: the player can invest in the product or go to the next stage of development, paying the fee. If another player has already invested in this product, the current player can pay him royalties or go for a hostile take-over to become the market leader.
- Chance : the player takes a chance-card and may get or lose money.
- Strategy : these cards give the players an advantage (hostile take-over, protection, Nobel-prize, investment bonus or grants).
- Start : each time the player passes start, he's paid a salary.
- Artesia (bank where the player gets money), OCenW (player gets an education and passes this round) or InterChem2000group (the dice are thrown again and the player moves further on the board).
Players obtain victory points for each fully developed product (phase 4), for each market they dominate and if they win a Nobel-prize.
The winner is the player who manages to first gain the predetermined number of victory points.

141296.name: Quarry
141296.description:
From the Introduction:

Even in some places where one might not suspect such a thing much sought after fine stone lies close under the surface. This quarry is one such place where the thin cover of soil and grass has been torn open to get at the stone beneath. Stone that is quarried here in big blocks and as gravel for the construction of monumental structures nearby and far away.
It helps that the hilly terrain makes it easy to get at the stone. After removing only a little earth the quarrymen were able to get quarry the precious good on no less than three levels with little effort. Although ramps connect these levels the heavy blocks of stone can be hauled away on each one of them. Even the tree trunks used to move the heavy stones can be cut in the immediate neighborhood of this quarry.

141297.name: Basketball Field
141297.description:
From the Introduction:

The large wall surrounding this city has long since been torn down and the resulting rubble was used to fill in the moat accompanying the wall. The area won this way was used to build two major roads routing traffic around all around the city and in between these roads enough room remained unused for a small park.

The roads, once major traffic routes have been partially replaced by modern highways and tunnels routing the city's traffic much more efficiently. The park though is as popular as ever. In some spots the meadows and trees have been replaced by modern sports facilities like this basketball field.

Surrounded by a high mesh fence and flanked by the trees of the park as well as the now rather quite roads this field is high in demand. Numerous teams from the neighborhood as well as nearby schools take their turns playing on the field. These teams are responsible for the fields maintenance as well, although this is not much of a chore. Only the waste bins next to the field have to be emptied regularly.

141298.name: Aquedukt
141298.description:
From the Introduction:

A small but steep valley cut into the ground by the small river currently flowing peacefully at its bottom divides the land. While a dirt road runs along the rivers length using the valley as a natural traffic route the fresh water for a nearby town has to be moved across the valley. Resourceful builders bridged the valley with a small two tier aqueduct. This way the water can flow across the valley without problems and neither the traffic on the road or the water in the small stream are staunched in the least. As a bonus travelers wanting to cross the valley can now do so without having to climb to its bottom and getting their feet wet.

141299.description:
Do Your Job is a fast, family fun game. It comes with two different variants. One is a collecting game (similar to Gin Rummy or Spoons) with a twist and the other is a mind-bender with a betting mechanic.

In the original game variant, each player will attempt to obtain all the elements needed in order to complete their job from the card piles at the center of the table; they will need to find a Job card and the necessary Job Item card(s) during the game. Each turn players will draw a card from the top of a deck, discard a card face up onto a deck, and move a card from one deck to another (you may do these actions in any order, but you must do them all). If you successfully have all the cards necessary to Do Your Job at any point on your turn, you win!

Jobs are not so easily done, though. The corporate world is a cruel mistress, and the player must try to figure out the other players' jobs in order to thwart jobs being done. If people realize what job you are trying to do, desired cards can be buried within one of the decks during other players' discard or move action since you can only draw from the top of a pile.

In the Treachery game variant, each player tries to win the most points. They will accomplish this by first betting for the round. Then players will play a job card (either the Pirate or the Dwarf) and a number card face down. The pirates will then flip their bet (positive to negative or negative to positive) and switch number cards with the other players according to the arrows. Whoever has the highest number will win all the bets and play will repeat in this fashion. Be wary though, for if each person plays the Pirate, the bets will be flipped, but everyone keeps their number card.
141299.name: Do Your Job

24973.name: Mythical Eras of War, Games, LLC.

141300.description:
Era of the Ninja is a game of stealth and combat in which players take on the role of ninja attempting to eliminate the lord of a castle in feudal Japan. Players may sneak through the castle or fight, but must be careful as the enemy is actively searching for them. As the players succeed, they gain ingenuity, which can be used to increase their arsenal of equipment or gain new skills for use in the search for the lord. Combat against enemy units has a wound mechanism that allows players to weaken their enemy before dealing a final blow and characters also have the use of mystical ki to help them overcome the obstacles ahead of them. Players must be careful though as the enemy gains strength in numbers. Players must find a way to survive long enough to locate defeat the lord to claim victory. In the end, only one player can be declared the victor – the one who defeats the lord!

Era of the Ninja comes with multiple levels of play from Basic for new players to Advanced, which increases the challenge for veteran players. There are also different modes of play from Regular play, True co-op mode, Death Match, Team Death Match, and Head of the Lord allowing players the ability to choose their favorite type of game and play style.
141300.name: Era of the Ninja

141301.name: The Anansi
141301.description:
From Introduction:

There are spiders and there are flies, and you are a spider. You are the weaver of webs both physical and spiritual, and while you may play the fool, you always get what you want... eventually.

Sometimes you feel bad. Some of the flies are neat, after all. Sometimes you want to help them. Sometimes you even do help them. But eventually you always come back to what’s really important...how they can help you.

141302.name: The Boy & His Dog
141302.description:
From Introduction:

No matter where you go, you're always alone in this world. Sure, there's other people, but they all have their own wants and needs and they're looking out for number one. Not you. You've got a true friend.

You've got a Dog.

141303.name: Fabulous Finds
141303.description:
Fabulous Finds brings an exciting twist to the seek-and-find genre where an eye for design and profitable rewards are key. The game follows the user who, after inheriting a beautiful home in Carmel, CA from Great Aunt Beatrice, will arrive to find a diamond in the rough. Aunt Bea's larger-than-life personality and equally eccentric collector's eye doesn’t quite fit with the average person’s home-decorating style. With a passion for interior design but a pocketbook that doesn’t quite fit the fervor, there is only one thing to do-have a yard sale! Gamers will sort through rooms to find items that fit the theme of the upcoming yard sale, match shoppers to the treasures they desire and use the profits to redecorate each room.

Features
Find treasures throughout your house, then play fun mini-games to sort and repair items to get the best price
Haggle with shoppers at the yard sale to get the most cash
What does each eclectic shopper want? Solve the riddles to help everyone find bargains at your sale
Use the money you earn at your yard sale to redecorate your house buy new furniture, paint the walls and make it your own

Source: The Developer Website.

141304.name: Fancy Nancy: Tea Party Time!
141304.description:
You are cordially invited to the most decadent tea party of the decade: and with Nancy as the party planner, you know it's going to be a fancy fete. Pick out your favorite string of pearls, find a splendiferous skirt and slide into a chic pair of shoes; on this adventure, you'll want to look your best. Nancy and your host, Mrs. DeVine, need help to put on the perfect party, and it's up to you to find all of the supplies that will make this soiree a day to remember. You'll need a serving of spunk, a supply of smarts and glamour galore as you team up with everyone's favorite pint-size fancy-pants. Fancy Nancy: Tea Party Time! takes you right into the pages of the book series that's tickled the fancy of millions of kids! For the Nintendo DS.

Source: The Developer Website.

141305.name: Mountains of Sorrow
141305.description:
In this game, you play as Derin Hawk, a dedicated soldier trying desperately to stop the enemy known as Them. They emerged long ago and have quickly destroyed the once peaceful nation. Now, you must enter the mountain from which they came, in hopes of finding a way to stop them.

After picking a mission, you will use the appropriate enemy cards and weapons. By taking cover (and you must take cover, or you WILL die) and laying strategic fire, you will be able to advance through the map. Do you use an action to move spaces, or do you cover fire? Do you take cover after you move, or stand in the open? And what weapons do you pick up or save for later?

Combat uses many dice, as you roll die equal to your power, scoring a hit for each dice equal to your accuracy. You deal the weapons damage for each hit. Enemies follow the same rules.

This is not one of those games where the enemies are weaker but more numerous. It is where the enemies are both the same as you and more numerous. Ha! Ha!

Can you save humanity?

141306.name: Fear Factor Delerium
141306.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Fun, humorous, gross... and ADDICTIVE! Bite into the spiders, maggots and other nasty, squirming pieces so you can jam them into the puzzle. Avoid the voids, guys! Splatter the matter by packing those tasty treats into solid rows and watch them dissolve in stomach acid! Take a couple antacids together and create an explosion of acid rain! Bite into too many bad spots though, and you'll kick the bucket... CHUCK BUCKET, that is! Each level gets harder and faster. If the food items top out, you'll be too sick to continue and it'll be GAME OVER! Do you have what it takes? Can you hang in there to level 20? Is fear a factor for you? DELIrium has multiple (20) puzzle levels with truly sick and unique graphics. Puzzles progress to higher levels of difficulty and the many forms of combinations allow for the biggest scores and rewarding gameplay... DELIruim is something you can really sink your teeth into!

Source: The Developer Website.

141307.name: Batman: Arkham Origins

videogamehonor.33132: 2013 CVA Best Animation of the Year Winner

141307.description:
Batman: Arkham Origins features an expanded Gotham City and introduces an original prequel storyline occurring several years before the events of Batman: Arkham Asylum and Batman: Arkham City. Taking place before the rise of Gotham City's mist dangerous villains and assassins, the game showcases a young, raw, unrefined Batman as he faces a defining moment in his early career as a crime fighter that sets his path to becoming the Dark Knight. As the story unfolds witness identities being formed and key relationships being forged.

Source: The Game Website.

189398.name: Panzer Grenadier: Iron Curtain - Maple Leaf Brigade

141308.description:
From the publisher's website:

Three years after the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics and the United States jointly vanquished Nazi terror, the two former allies began a four-decade-long Cold War. While it never ignited into a Third World War, both sides armed for it, trained for it, and planned for it. Iron Curtain - Hammer and Sickle (a Panzer Grenadier game) explores the use of huge tanks and other weapons prepared for this war that never happened. Besides the twenty scenarios, players can take the role of the 11th Tank Corps, 8th Guards Army as it fights a hypothetical campaign to seize the American airfields at Rhein Main (Frankfurt am Main) and Wiesbaden, followed by the border crossings near Saarbrücken.

Unlike most other Panzer Grenadier titles, Hammer and Sickle covers battles that never happened. We’ve given you one plausible scenario background leading to war, that provides the setting and troops for the scenarios and campaign included.

Hammer and Sickle includes 77 mounted and die-cut Soviet playing pieces. Playing all of the scenarios and the campaign in this supplement requires the use of the included pieces plus boards and pieces from our Road to Berlin and Elsenborn Ridge games.
141308.name: Panzer Grenadier: Iron Curtain – Hammer & Sickle

141309.name: Batman: Arkham Origins Blackgate

videogamehonor.31956: 2013 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

141309.description:
Armature is partnering with WB Games to create a handheld Arkham game – Batman: Arkham Origins Blackgate. The game is a 2.5D Metroid-style exploration game, releasing day-and-date with the console version on October 25, 2013.

Source: The Developer Website.

141310.name: Mutants & Machine-guns Rulebook
141310.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long, long time ago before the wars began, man was ruler of the earth. But one result of the terrible wars was that creatures rose from the ashes of the unknown. The genes of the earth's animals and plants were altered, until strange, new creatures arose - creatures of the awesome power and fierceness and often great intelligence.

You have lived all your years among such creatures and among the strange artefacts - inexplicable, often dangerous- of the Ancients who created this now devastated civilization whose ruins you live among the world of Mutants & Machine-guns!

141311.name: Flyin' Frogs
141311.description:
Hop and jump your way through dozens of perilous mazes... dangerous to FROGS that is! That's ok, because you are armed with poisonous frog venom! Spit at your enemies, which include prickly pineapples, wrapped mumies, robot balls, and more. Upgrade your spit to double spit and triple spit. Next, you'll be ready for spit bombs and spit grenades. There are no table manners in this arcade maze game.

Different Worlds to Explore:
Jungly Tropics
Polar Ice Caps
Crazy Castles
Spookey Space

Source: The Developer Website.
